* [People Records Overview](/site/knowledgebase/people-records-overview) * [How do I create a new People record?](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-create-a-new-people-record) * [Importing People](/site/knowledgebase/importing-people)
Notes on People Records

Notes are pieces of information you can log for reference on a People Record. They are best used for recording observations about a patron or organization, their preferences, or bits of prospect research.
This section of a People Record is free-form. It houses whatever details you deem relevant to doing business with this person that don't fit into action. Basically, notes can be used to document anything from general patron housekeeping to fun facts about that person that will help you make your next conversation with that person a little bit more personal.
If you click on a note, and then click on the Edit button, you'll see more details about which user created the note and when.
You can also star important notes. Only the first three starred notes will show up on the top of a People Record, but the rest will appear when you click the "X more notes" link.
![people record with notes](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=229 "people record")
### Related Topics
* [People Records Overview](/site/knowledgebase/people-records-overview) * [How do I create a new People record?](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-create-a-new-people-record)
Anonymous Records

An Anonymous record is created when a patron's information is not included during a box office ticket purchase. Artful.ly will still keep track of the purchase and add it to the show/event info including number and type of ticket sold, and amount of earned income. Because no specific patron information is attached to the sale, however, Artful.ly places the purchase into your Anonymous record. You can either leave them all there or assign them to a patron later. Prevention, of course, is always the best cure.
**Make sure you ask for a patron's name and email address when they buy tickets at the box office so your records are clear and they receive a receipt for the transaction.**
![anonymous record](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=231 "anonymous record")
Note: Anonymous records often show a very high lifetime value since they are a compilation of many different people.
### Finding Your Anonymous Record
**You can find your Anonymous record through the people menu under search.** Type in ANONYMOUS and the record will appear.
### Reassigning an Action from Anonymous to Another People Record
**If you know who made a purchase that was recorded under your Anonymous Record, you can reassign the action.**
1. Select the action. 2. Click **View Order Details**. 3. Click the **Work With...** button in the top left corner. 4. Choose **Assign Person**. 5. Select which patron you would like to be assigned the action.
Voila!
![reassigning actions](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=232 "reassigning actions")
### Related Articles - [Actions and the Action Feed](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed) - [Edit Information on People Records](/site/knowledgebase/edit-information-on-people-records)
How do I delete a People record?

You can only delete People records that do not have any actions logged on on them.
1. Find the record 2. Click the **Work With **button ![deleting a people record](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=616 "deleting records") 3. Select **Delete** 4. Delete the record
If you want to delete a People record that has actions logged on it, you must first delete any action you manually logged, then delete the whole record. You cannot delete actions logged automatically by the Artful.ly system including ticket orders or donations. If you could delete these actions then it would create inaccuracies in the system's bookkeeping.
### Related Articles - [Actions & the Action Feed](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed) - [How do I create a new people record?](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-create-a-new-people-record)
What happens if patrons mistype their email addresses?

If a patron makes an order and mistypes her email address, the purchase will still complete and the patron will be added to your door list. Fixing it is super easy:
1. [Correct the email address on the patron's record.](/site/knowledgebase/edit-information-on-people-records) 2. [Resend the Order Confirmation](/site/knowledgebase/resending-receipts).
This is one of the hardest design choices to make with a ticketing software. Because the room for human error on any online form is high—and any error that prevents checking out increases the probability the patron won't try again—Artful.ly errs on the side of letting patrons check out so they can still get to your event. Patrons who mistype their emails—but still check out—will be listed on your door list, so even if a patron enters a wrong email address, she can still check in at your event and see your work.
With paid tickets, the patron will usually contact you to double-check if the purchase was successful before attempting to purchase again. When this happens, you can [correct the email address](/site/knowledgebase/edit-information-on-people-records) on the patron record and an [order confirmation may be resent](/site/knowledgebase/resending-receipts). This information can also be corrected at the door or post-event.
We agree that it's annoying to have misspelled email addresses created in your CRM, but because it's something that can be fixed at a later time, we want to make it as easy as possible for your patrons to attend your event and see your work, rather than have the relationship stop at the ticket buying process.
In our experience, typos in emails effect a small number of patrons compared to the overall audience, and sometimes correcting the information can present an opportunity to deepen a relationship with a patron.
### Related Articles
* [Edit Information On People Records](/site/knowledgebase/edit-information-on-people-records) * [Resending Receipts](/site/knowledgebase/resending-receipts) * [Refund, Return, and Exchange Tickets](/site/knowledgebase/refund-exchange-and-return-tickets) * [Merging People Records](/site/knowledgebase/merging-people-records)
Merging People Records

## What do I do with duplicate records?
**Dupes happen! To clean up your records and combine two duplicate records:**
![merging is found under work with on people records](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=233 "people record")
1. Determine which of the two records has more accurate information--this is the "winner." The other record is the "loser." The winner's contact details (name, email, address, website) will override the loser's. The loser's notes, actions, and tags will be added to the winner's record. 2. Open up the loser record. 3. Select the **Work With Button**. 4. Choose **Merge**. 5. Type the name or e-mail address of the winner into search field at the top of the page. You can also select the record from the list or recently opened records that will appear on the right. 6. Confirm the merge (or cancel if you messed up).
### Related Topics
* [People Records Overview](/site/knowledgebase/people-records-overview) * [How do I create a new People record?](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-create-a-new-people-record) * [Actions & The Action Feed](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed)
Editing Communication Preferences

Communication preferences are primarily a way for you to keep track of how a person prefers to be contacted. This section includes two fields: **Do Not Call** and **Do Not Email**. Simply select whichever box on your fan's record to make these changes.
![editing communications preferences with the do not call or do not email checkboxes](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=233 "edit communications preferences")
* **Do Not Call:** Checking this box will not do anything. The person's phone number will still be saved on their record but staff will see not to call them.
* **Do Not Email:** If you have the MailChimp Kit activated, checking this box will unsubscribe the person from any MailChimp lists. If you don't have the MailChimp Kit, nothing will happen. Either way, checking this box will not delete the person's email address.
Once you've selected the person's preferences, click on "Save" to save them to their record.
### Related Articles - [Edit Information on People Records](/site/knowledgebase/edit-information-on-people-records)
Box Office: Sell Tickets at the Door

**The Box Office is a private sales channel you and your staff can use to sell tickets at the door or over the phone.** It also provides easy access to your Door List to check in patrons as they arrive. There are no ticket fees applied to Box Office sales. You only pay the credit card processing fee if you sell tickets via card.
## To Reach the Box Office:
1. Select the **Event** and **Show** you are selling tickets for. If you are selling tickets to the next upcoming show, you will see the box office button available on your Event Dashboard under **Next Showing**. 2. Select the** Box Office** button from the shaded grey area underneath the show date and time. ![navigating to the box office](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=238 "navigating to the box office")
## To Sell Tickets:
1. **Select a Ticket Type and choose how many tickets to sell in the order.** If you have activated a donation kit or created discount codes, you will see options to add a **Donation** or apply a **Discount Code** to the order.
![box office ticket selectors](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=235 "box office ticket selectors")
2. **Select the Payment Type: Cash, Credit, Check, or Comp.** Various fields for payment details and Buyer Info fields will be displayed depending on the payment type you select.
* **Cash** payments do not require any patron information, but recording a name or email is always encouraged. * **Credit Card** payments require a patron's name and either an email address or phone number. * **Check** payments allow you to record the check number. * **Comp **payments are great for logging complementary tickets given to press, staff, friends, and family. We suggest recording a reason for the comp in the Order Notes field. Comp tickets will not send an email notification to the patron unless you select the checkbox to send the fan a confirmation email.
3. **Complete the required payment details and Buyer Info fields.** When you start to type in the patron's name or email, Artful.ly will suggest existing people in your records. If you select one of these suggested matches, the rest of the fields will autofill for you. This will also help prevent duplicate records.
![box office checkout fields](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=236 "box office checkout fields")
4. **Choose whether to check in the patron or not**. Checking in a patron marks him/her as attended on Door List and adds a Went Actionto the patron's People Record.
![box office checkout button](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=806 "checkout button with mark as received and confirmation options")
5. **Hit the Checkout button.**
## Receipts
An email order confirmation will be sent for sales conducted through the Box Office if the patron's email is entered or in your records. For comp sales, you need to check the box that's labeled "Send individual confirmation of this comp." In general, it's a good idea to send an email confirmation for comp orders, especially if you're using the print-at-home scannable tickets kit. If you have a case where sending a confirmation email would be confusing you can leave the box unchecked.
## Credit Card Readers
If you want to make your door sales go even faster, get a USB credit card reader. These generic devices are available from places like Amazon.com for $20-$50. We've tested the **Magtek SureSwipe Card Reader 21040145** and can vouch for that model.
Plug the USB card reader into your desktop or laptop USB port, then select the Credit Card payment type in the Box Office interface, and swipe a credit card. The card number and expiration date will get pulled into the appropriate fields. This improves speed and accuracy.
Artful.ly does not currently support card readers for mobile devices. If this feature is a priority for you, show your support in our [Feature Request Forum](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/feature_request_list).
## Related Articles
* [Door List: Check in Your Patrons at Showtime](/site/knowledgebase/door-list-check-in-your-patrons-at-showtime) * [Box Office Tips](/site/knowledgebase/box-office-tips)
Beta: Member-Only Events & Shows

## Member Only Events—get exclusive.
Beyond offering a member price for a ticket, you may also want to host an event or shows open exclusively to your members.
**To Create Member-Only Events:**
These events are only visible when your members are logged into your storefront.
1. Create an event. 2. Under **Event Details**, select **About**. 3. Check the **Members Only** checkbox and **Save**.
![Member Only Event](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=240 "Member Only Event") 4. Proceed through the rest of your event set up.
The events will display when a member is logged into the members-only storefront.
![Member Storefront](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=242 "Member Storefront")
**To Create Member-Only Shows:**
These shows are visible to the public but the only tickets available are member-only tickets.
1. Create an event with a member ticket type. 2. Select the type of membership the ticket type is available to. 3. Do not create any ticket types that are not member-only.
**Some More Options:**
* If you make a member ticket type and leave the **Storefront and Widgets** availability box checked, the ticket type will be visible to anyone who visits your storefront. The member only ticket type will appear _Sold Out_ to non-members. Members will need to log into your storefront to add these tickets to the cart. * If **Storefront and Widgets **is unchecked, but the **Members **box is checked (see image below), the ticket type will only be visible when members are logged into your storefront. * Leaving **Box Office** checked will allow your Box Office staff to sell this ticket type over the phone and at the door. Box office sales of member tickets are not restricted, so box office staff may need to check if the patron is a member in your CRM, or offer to sell the patron a membership using the Sales Console.
![Member Only Event](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=241 "Member Only Event")
### Related Articles
* [How Members Buy Member Tickets](/site/knowledgebase/beta-how-members-buy-member-tickets) * [Member-Only Ticket Types](/site/knowledgebase/beta-member-only-ticket-types)
Beta: Member-Only Ticket Types

## Member-Only Ticket Types
Member-only ticket types allow you to set up a ticket type exclusively for your members. These tickets can either be discounted or free.
**To create a member ticket type**:
1. Add a new **Ticket Type** 2. Under **Member Ticket** select **Yes** 3. Define how many tickets a single member may purchase in a transaction 4. Choose where the ticket is **Visible**
* **Storefront & Widgets**: Selecting this checkbox makes the member ticket type visible in your public storefront. Member-only ticket types will appear in the public storefront appear as "Sold Out" until the member logs in. * **Box Offic**e: This checkbox makes this ticket available in the box office so your staff can sell the ticket over the phone or at the door. Box office staff should check the patron's member record in the CRM to verify a membership. * **Members**: This checkbox causes the ticket type to appear when the member is logged in. To make a ticket type only visible to members, you should check this box, and leave Storefront & Widgets unchecked.
![Member Front Row Seats](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=246 "Member Front Row Seats")
## To Purchase Member-Only Tickets
With the Membership Kit activated, your patrons will see a **Member Login** button in the upper right corner of your Storefront, along with an option to **Become a Member**. Once a member logs in, member-only ticket types become available.
![Demo Member Bar](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=244 "Demo Member Bar")
### Related Articles
* [How Members Buy Member Tickets](/site/knowledgebase/beta-how-members-buy-member-tickets)
Door List: Check In Your Patrons At Showtime

**If you have Internet access available at your venue, you can check in your patrons as they arrive through the Door List.** The Door List integrates with the Box Office, so you can sell tickets and check in patrons as they arrive.
## To Access the Door List
Select the **Event** and **Show** you want to check people in for. If you are checking in patrons to your next show. There are two ways to access the door list.
1. When clicking on your event you'll see a door list button under **Next Show**.
![navigate to door list through next show](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=247 "navigate to door list")
2. Or if you need to view the door list for a later show, click on **Shows **and then **List**.
![list view](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=248 "list view")
You can then click on the show date, and use the **Work With **button to find the door list.
![work with door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=249 "work with door list")
## Using the Door List
Here you can see every person who has purchased tickets for the show.
![viewing the door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=250 "viewing the door list")
## **To View an Order:**
1. Click on the patron's name to see their order in the left column. 2. Click the **Check Box** for each member of the patron's party present. You can leave a box unchecked if someone hasn't arrived, yet. Checking this box adds a **Went Action** to that patron's record. 3. As you check in patrons, you'll see the bar fill at the top of the screen; this shows your **total attendance**. The circle next to the patron's name will also begin to fill as you check in patrons. A half circle is partially checked-in, and a black circle indicates a fully checked-in party.
![partial check in](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=251 "partial check in")
## But Wait, There's More...
* The **Sell Tickets** Button makes it easy to switch back and forth between your **Door List** and the **Box Office** * You can **Download** the door list as a PDF or CSV. This is useful if you don't have internet access at your venue, or if you need to perform an export to email all of your ticket buyers.
![sell tickets and download door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=252 "sell tickets and download door list")
Additionally, you'll also receive a copy of the door list in your email 90 minutes before showtime. Here's what the email looks like:
![90 Minutes Before Showtime Email Example](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=624 "Door List Email")
This way you'll always have a backup in your email inbox. Organization Administrators are automatically set to receive these emails, but other staff members can, as well. If you'd like to have additional staff members receive the door list, or to turn the feature off for your email, check out this article: [Adding Users & Managing User Permissions](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/adding-users-managing-user-permissions-).
## Related Articles
* [Box Office: Sell Tickets at the Door](/site/knowledgebase/box-office-sell-tickets-at-the-door) * [Box Office Tips](/site/knowledgebase/box-office-tips) * [Adding Users & Managing User Permissions](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/adding-users-managing-user-permissions-).
The Artful.ly App: Door List for Your iPhone or iPod Touch

The Artful.ly iOS app can be used on its own to check patrons in to your events using the door list. It's basically the same door list you see on your computer rolled up into a handy mobile app. This functionality is described below.
The Artful.ly iOS app can also be used in conjunction with the Scannable Ticketing Kit to scan the QR codes on patrons' tickets to expedite check-in. Scanning functionality is described in [this article](/site/knowledgebase/the-artful-ly-app-scan-tickets-with-your-iphone-or-ipod-touch).
## Download the App
The Artful.ly app is available in the iOS App Store.
[Download it here](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/artful.ly/id862530729?mt=8)
## Log In
Log in to the app using your Artful.ly account credentials.
![Artful.ly app sign in](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=279 "sign in")
## Events List
Once logged in you'll see your **Events List**. The top portion of the screen will list every show your organization has scheduled today, along with a list of all of your upcoming events.
![events list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=280 "events list")
Tapping the name of an event will take you to a list of all the scheduled shows in that event.
![show list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=281 "show list")
## Scan Screen
Tapping a show date will take you to the scan screen, which shows you the view from your device's camera. You won't have anything to scan here unless you've activated the Scannable Ticketing Kit and your patrons are presenting their QR codes at the door. [Read more about that here.](/site/knowledgebase/print-at-home-scannable-tickets-kit)
Even without the Scannable Ticketing Kit turned on, there's useful info on this page. The fraction on middle left side of the screen is the check-in count. It shows the number of tickets checked-in over the number of tickets sold to that show. Tap **View Door List** to see your ticket holders.
![view door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=286 "view door list")
## Door List
Tapping on **View Door List** will show you every ticket buyer for the show.
![notes on the door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=283 "notes on door list")
When viewing the Door List, **swiping to the left** on the "**>**" icon next to the "i" allows you to check in an entire order.
![swipe to check in](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=285 "swipe to check in")
## Order Details Screen
You can access the order details for any patron from the door list screen by tapping on the **(i)**, or by touching the patron's name after a successful ticket scan.
Tickets can be checked in or out individually from an Order Details screen.
**Special Instructions** and **Order Notes** are also found in a customer's Order Details. If a ticket buyer has either, it will be indicated with an exclamation point inside a yellow triangle on the Door List.
![special instructions in app](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=287 "special instructions")
## Pro Tips
* When checking in a party with one large order, it's often easier to scan one ticket, and then tap on the name on the order to go to the order details screen. You can then quickly tap the Check in button for the rest of the tickets on the order. * Take a beat between scanning tickets.There is a small pause between consecutive ticket scans. This is intended to help keep track of check-ins.
## Related Articles
* [The Artful.ly App: Scan Tickets With Your iPhone or iPod Touch](/site/knowledgebase/the-artful-ly-app-scan-tickets-with-your-iphone-or-ipod-touch) * [Scannable Tickets Kit](/site/knowledgebase/print-at-home-scannable-tickets-kit) * [Door List: Check In Your Patrons At Showtime](/site/knowledgebase/door-list-check-in-your-patrons-at-showtime)
Beta: How Patrons Become Members

With the Membership Kit activated, you will have four channels through which your fans can become members.
1. A patron can buy her own membership on your public Storefront 2. You can sell a patron an membership via the Sales Console 3. You can give a single patron a complementary membership via their People Record 4. You can give several people complementary memberships through Advanced Search and List Segments
## 1) Membership Storefront
When you activate the Membership Kit you'll find a new **Become a Member** item in the navigation bar of your Storefront. You will also see a new Member Login link in the upper-right corner of the Storefront navigation bar.
![Demo Member Bar](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=244 "Demo Member Bar")
When a patron clicks **Become a Member** they are taken to your Membership Storefront. The process for buying a membership follows similar conventions to purchasing tickets to a show. A patron selects a membership, adds it to his cart, and then checks out.
![Become a Member](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=253 "Become a Member")
## 2) Sales Console
It's also possible to sell memberships through the Sales Console:
1. Select the Memberships tile.
![Membership Sales Console](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=254 "Membership Sales Console") 2. Select the Membership Type.
![Add Memberships](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=255 "Add Memberships") 3. Click the **Check Out** tile to add payment information. The Sales Console checkout process will feel very similar to the Box Office.
## 3) Comping a Single Membership
1. Find the individual's People Record 2. Select **Work With** 3. Choose **Comp Membership** from the drop down menu.
## 4) Bulk Comping Memberships
1. Select a pre-existing List Segment or use Advanced Search to define a group of people 2. Click **Work With** 3. Choose **Comp Memberships** from the drop down menu.
## What Happens Next?
When a patron buys a membership they receive two emails:
1. **Order Confirmation:** This is the patron's receipt. It's sent from support@artful.ly. Nothing fancy here. 2. **Membership Instructions:** This email includes a link to a page where the new member can create a password to access member-only events and tickets. You can also customize some text in this email from the [Membership Kit Configuration page](/site/knowledgebase/beta-configure-your-membership-storefront). The reply-to address on this email is whatever you've set up as your general organization contact email. The line after the salutation contains the optional custom message from when you created the membership type.
![Membership Confirmation Email](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=256 "Membership Confirmation Email") 3. **Membership Card: **Your Patrons will also receive a Membership Card as an email attachment. The Membership Card may be scanned with the Artful.ly App to check patrons into events.
## Pro Tips
* You may want add a link to the Member Sign In page on your site. This way your patrons can easily log in to see member events and tickets. * It's a good idea to include some custom text in your welcome email if your organization plans to use Membership Cards.
### Related Articles
- [Configure Your Membership Storefront](/site/knowledgebase/beta-configure-your-membership-storefront) - [Sales Console](/site/knowledgebase/sales-console-a-private-sales-channel-for-complex-orders) - [Comp Memberships](/site/knowledgebase/beta-comp-memberships) - [Printing Membership Cards](/site/knowledgebase/beta-printing-membership-cards) - [How Members Buy Member Tickets](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/beta-how-members-buy-member-tickets)
Beta: How Members Buy Member Tickets

Member tickets can be sold through several sales channels:
## Storefront
1. Member logs in to your organization's storefront and can see member ticket types and prices. 2. Member purchases the tickets independently.
![Member Storefront](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=242 "Member Storefront")
## Sales Console
For more complicated over-the-phone orders, you can sell member tickets through the Sales Console:
1. Search for the person's record to verify the membership. 2. On the record, click ***Work With** and **Sell to**.
![Member Sell To](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=268 "Member Sell To") 3. You'll then be taken to the **Sales Console** to complete the sale. The person's contact information from the record will automatically populate in the checkout screen.
## Box Office
Member tickets at the door are best sold through the Box Office:
1. Search for the patron's **People Record** and verify the membership. 2. Then you can sell the member ticket via the Box Office according to your organization's business rules for membership.
## Member Card
If a member has printed her member card, he/she can present this just like a ticket. You can scan the card at the door and the member's tickets will be checked into the door list.
If a member has not purchased tickets in advance and the event has free tickets for members, then you can scan a patron's member card. This will sell a free ticket to the member and check them in with one scan.
![Member Card](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=267 "Member Card")

* [Configure Your Membership Storefront](/site/knowledgebase/beta-configure-your-membership-storefront) * [Sales Console](/site/knowledgebase/sales-console-for-memberships) * [Box Office: Sell Tickets at the Door](/site/knowledgebase/box-office-sell-tickets-at-the-door) * [Printing Membership Cards](/site/knowledgebase/beta-printing-membership-cards)
Beta: Upgrade or Change a Patron's Membership Type

It's easy to change or upgrade a patron's membership to a different membership type.
1. Open the patron's record and click the **Member Tag **or the **Membership ID Number**. This will open the patron's Member History.
![David Richard People Record](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=274 "David Richard People Record") 2. Check the box of the membership you want to upgrade.
![David Richard Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=275 "David Richard Membership") 3. Select **Work With** and **Change Membership Type.**
![Work With Change Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=277 "Work With Change Membership") 4. Select the new **Membership Type** and **Payment Method**.
![Change Membership Type](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=273 "Change Membership Type")
**Notes**
* Credit card upgrades can be processed within Artful.ly. The normal 5% fee for membership applies. * Cash sales can be recorded. * Membership upgrades may be comped. * It is not currently possible to record a membership upgrade via check.
### Related Articles - [Change Membership Expiration](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/beta-change-membership-expiration)
Beta: Comp Memberships

In order to comp a membership to a patron:
1. Find the person's record.
2. Click the **Work With** button and select **Comp Membership.**
![Comp Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=291 "Comp Membership")
3. Select the **Membership Type.**
4. Then, you'll have the opportunity to record **Order Notes.** Here you can describe why you're giving away a membership (eg. Gave Sally comp membership because she gave us $10k.)
5. Choose an **Expiration Date.**
6. Choose whether or not to **Notify** the patron.
* It's recommended to take order notes on why the patron is being comped the membership. * In most cases, you'll want the patron notified of the comped membership. Notifying the patron will send the **confirmation and password invitation emails** to that person's email address. You'll be able to enter a **custom message** during the process.
![Comp Membership Details](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=289 "Comp Membership Details")
## Bulk Comping Memberships
It's also possible to comp memberships in bulk. There are two ways to do it:
**From Advanced Search:** Perform an advanced search and use the **Work With** button and select **Comp Memberships**.
![Advanced Search Bulk Comp Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=288 "Advanced Search Bulk Comp Membership")
**From a List Segment**: Open the List Segment you would like to Comp memberships for. Use the **Work With** button and select **Comp Memberships**.
![List Segment Bulk Comp Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=290 "List Segment Bulk Comp Membership")
### Related Articles - [Sales Console for Memberships](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/sales-console-for-memberships)
The Artful.ly App: Scan Tickets With Your iPhone or iPod Touch

With the [Scannable Tickets Kit activated](/site/knowledgebase/print-at-home-scannable-tickets-kit), you can use the Artful.ly iOS app to scan the QR code on your patrons' tickets and check them in at your events.
## Download the App
The Artful.ly app is available in the Apple App Store.
[Download the app here](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/artful.ly/id862530729?mt=8)
## Log In
Log in to the app using your Artful.ly account credentials.
![Artful.ly app sign in](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=292 "sign in")
## Events List
Once logged in you'll see your **Events List**. The top portion of the screen will list every show your organization has scheduled today, along with a list of all of your upcoming events.
![events list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=293 "events list")
Tapping the name of an event will take you to a list of all the scheduled shows in that event.
![show list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=294 "show list")
## Scan Screen
The fraction on middle left side of the screen is the **check-in count**. It shows the number of tickets checked-in over the number of tickets sold to that show.
![Scan screen](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=296 "scan screen")
## Scan Validation Messages
When scanning a ticket or Membership Card you will see one of these three messages:
1. **Success** appears if the ticket is validated; the guideline box will turn green. If you see this message—great. The ticket has been checked in.
![ticket scan success](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=297) 2. **Ticket is already validated** appears in red if the ticket has already been scanned.
![ticket already validated](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=298 "Ticket already validated") 3. **Ticket could not be found** appears if the ticket is not for this show or event. Check the **Date** and **Event Name** on the patron's ticket to make sure it's correct.
![ticket could not be found](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=299 "ticket could not be found")
## Pro Tips
* When checking in a party with a large order, it's often easier to scan one ticket, and then tap on the **Patron's Name** to go to the order details screen. You can then quickly tap the **Check in** button for the rest of the tickets on the order. * Take a beat between scanning tickets.There is a small pause between when tickets can be scanned. This is intended to help keep track of how many tickets you have checked in. * It's possible to scan a QR code off a patron's phone, but the brightness on a patron's device must be turned up high in order to scan it.
## Related Articles
* [The Artful.ly App: Door List For Your iPhone or iPod Touch](/site/knowledgebase/the-artful-ly-app-door-list-for-your-iphone-or-ipod-touch) * [Scannable Tickets Kit](/site/knowledgebase/print-at-home-scannable-tickets-kit) * [Door List: Check In Your Patrons At Showtime](/site/knowledgebase/door-list-check-in-your-patrons-at-showtime)
Internal Notes & Special Instructions on Orders

## Internal Notes vs. Special Instructions
Bottom Line: Internal Notes and Special Instructions both appear on your Door List. Special Instructions are written by the ticket buyer, while Internal Notes are written by you, the producer.
## Special Instructions
Special Instructions are responses patrons submit through the check out process. This will only happen if you have turned on Special Instructions for the event. See [Asking a Question at Checkout](/site/knowledgebase/ask-patrons-a-question-at-checkout)
* Special Instructions cannot be edited after the tickets have been purchased. If a response changes, you should note that in an Internal Note.
## Internal Notes
You can make internal notes on Order Details or through internal sales channels like the Box Office and Sales Console.
![adding internal notes in the box office](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=302 "adding internal notes in the box office")
Or by finding the **Order Details** for a purchase and clicking the **+ Internal Note** Button.
![Add internal note](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=825 "edit order notes")
Making an Internal Note is useful for:
* Noting when patron transfers her ticket to someone else * Indicating a VIP ticketholder * Noting special seating instructions * Adding other information that will make your box office run more smoothly for your staff and patrons
## Viewing Internal Notes and Special Instructions
Internal Notes and Special Instructions appear on the left-hand side of the Box Office page when you click on a patron's name on the door list.
![order details and special instructions on the door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=304 "order details and special instructions on the door list")
When viewing the door list in the iOS app, notes are indicated with an exclamation point in a triangle next to a ticketholder's name.
![order details special instructions door list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=300 "order details special instructions door list")
Click that icon to open the order details and you'll see any Order Notes or Special Instructions at the top of the screen.
![order details special instructions individual order](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=301 "order details and special instructions")
## Related Articles * [Notes on People Records](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/notes-on-people-records) * [How do I make a note on an order?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-make-a-note-on-an-order) * [Ask Fans a Question at Checkout](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/ask-fans-a-question-at-checkout)
Box Office Tips

**Follow these tips for smooth box office management** and selling tickets during the pre-show rush, or even over the phone, will be a breeze.
## Train Box Office Staff on "Fake" Events **Designate a practice event and use it repeatedly for box office training purposes. **This will help you and your staff get the hang of selling tickets without messing up financial reports for actual productions. And practice will improve your efficiency with "live" ticket sales.
1. Create an event and name it "Fake" or "Test". 2. Add shows and ticket types to that event so you can simulate sales.
**What types of actions can one practice using a fake event?**
* Execute sales with each payment type including comps. * [Exchange and refund tickets](/site/knowledgebase/refund-exchange-and-return-tickets). * [Resend Receipts](/site/knowledgebase/resending-receipts)
## Open a Separate Window for People Records **Make sure you can easily navigate back and forth between the Box Office screen and People records. **This allows you to add a quick note to your patron's record for future reference. That's the beauty of a [CRM](/site/knowledgebase/what-is-a-crm-and-why-do-i-need-one)! It also affords you a ninja-like ability to troubleshoot ticket confusion. For example:
A patron shows up at the door and they are not on the door list. Before they bat an eyelash, you search their name or email in your People records, and find out exactly what happened with their alleged purchase.
## Verbally Confirm Ticket Orders and Credit Card Numbers **Repeat an order back to your patron before finalizing the sale: **"That's 2 tickets at $20 for 7:30 tomorrow night, correct?"
**Why is this important? **
* With a [USB Swiper](/site/knowledgebase/box-office-sell-tickets-at-the-door), the card is automatically charged the second you swipe. There is no "Sell" button to confirm the sale afterwards. * When manually entering a credit card number, it's a good idea to repeat the credit card number back to the patron especially when selling over the phone * Correcting an erroneous sale takes time you don't have during the pre-show rush. * You'll sound like a customer service rock star. Everyone loves efficiency!
## Related Articles * [Box Office: Sell Tickets at the Door](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/box-office-sell-tickets-at-the-door) * [Sales Channels Explained](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/sales-channels-explained) * [Door List: Check in your Fans at Showtime](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/door-list-check-in-your-patrons-at-showtime)
Can I run the Box Office from multiple computers?

**Q. Are there any problems with logging into my Artful.ly account to sell tickets to the same show on two different computers? **
A. You can create a second user in your organization's Artful.ly account, and have that user operate the second computer if you like. Note that the door list shown in the box office may not be completely in sync on both computers at all times. Refreshing the page will make sure you have the most current list.
Enabling Donations for 501(c)(3) Nonprofits

If you're a registered as a 501(c)(3) charity with the IRS, you can accept donations through Artful.ly by activating the **501(c)(3) Donations Kit**. Only the 3.5% credit card processing fee applies for donations made via Artful.ly using credit card.
1. Go to your **Account Administration** page and activate the kit.
![account administration kit detail](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=305 "account administration kits")
2. Submit a copy of the [**EFT Form**](https://www.artful.ly/forms/artfully_etf_sign_up.pdf), a **voided check**, and a copy of your organization's **IRS determination letter. This can be emailed to [support@artful.ly](mailto:support@artful.ly) or faxed to us at 815-366-8174, ATTN: Artfully.
**Please Note: Fractured Atlas fiscally sponsored projects are not 501(c)3's but can still use Artful.ly to receive donations using a different kit: the Sponsored Donation Kit. [Check out this article for more info on that kit.](/site/knowledgebase/donations-to-fiscally-sponsored-projects)**
Once we've activated the kit for you, go to your **Account Administration** page and press **Configure** in blue below the kit. This will bring you to the page where you can set your preferences and suggested gift levels.
![configure link on the 501(c)(3) Donations Kit](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=306 "configure link on the 501(c)(3) Donations Kit")
### Related Articles
* [How Can My Fans Make Online Donations?](/site/knowledgebase/how-can-my-fans-make-online-donations) * [Configuring the 501(c)(3) Donation Kit](/site/knowledgebase/configuring-the-501-c-3-donations-kit)
How can my fans make online donations?

There are four ways for your fans to make online donations to your organization with Artful.ly:
1. Add a donation to an order. 2. Make a donation through your Donation Storefront. (This option is for 501(c)(3)'s only.) 3. Through a Fractured Atlas Fiscal Sponsorship project page. 4. Make a donation directly from your website.
In order to make it possible to accept donations, turn on a donation kit from your **Account Administration** page:
* If you are Fiscally Sponsored by Fractured, Atlas, make sure your Artful.ly account is connected to your Fractured Atlas account to get the Sponsored Donations Kit. Read [this article](/site/knowledgebase/connect-your-sponsored-project-and-artful-ly-account) for detailed instructions on connecting. * If your organization is a registered 501(c)(3), [request the 501(c)(3) Donations Kit](/site/knowledgebase/enabling-donations-for-501-c-3-nonprofits). This requires an EFT form, a voided check, and a copy of your IRS determination letter.
## Add Donation to Order
* If you use the Artful.ly **Event Storefront** to promote your event, your ticket buyers will see a field to add a donation to their order at check out. * Fractured Atlas fiscally sponsored projects who connect their Fractured Atlas accounts to Artful.ly activate the Sponsored Donations Kit on their account. Any donations made on top of a ticket sale go to your sponsored fund. * If you're a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, you can customize the language here on your [501(c)(3) Donation Kit configuration page](/site/knowledgebase/configuring-the-501-c-3-donations-kit). Patrons will have the option to add special instructions to their donation.
![adding a donation at checkout](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=307 "adding a donation at checkout")
## Through a Sponsored Donations Page
* Fractured Atlas Sponsored Projects may also accept donations on their Fiscal Sponsorship project pages. * If your Fractured Atlas accounts and Artful.ly accounts are connected, any donations made on your profile will automatically import to your Artful.ly account.
![sponsored project donations page](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=308 "sponsored project donations page")
## Making a Donation Through Your Donation Storefront
* Possible for 501(c)(3) organizations, but not for Fractured Atlas fiscally sponsored projects. * This is an optional link on your **Central Storefront** that enables you to create suggested gifts. * Patrons click on the orange donation button to donate or you can send them directly to the URL for your Donation Storefront. * Once they have added a donation to their cart, they can continue to shop or press the blue **Checkout Now** button to complete their order. * Patrons will receive a confirmation email for their order. However, it's up to you to send them a tax receipt for their records.
![donation storefront for 501(c)(3) organizations](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=309 "501(c)(3) donation storefront")
### **To Configure Your Donation Storefront:**
1. Head to your **Account Administration** page, make sure that the **501(c)(3) Donations Kit** is activated. 2. Click **Configure** in blue and follow the [instructions here](/site/knowledgebase/configuring-the-501-c-3-donations-kit).
![account administration kit detail](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=310 "account administration kit detail")
## Making a Donation on Your Website
* To do this, you need to install either a [donation widget](/site/knowledgebase/what-is-the-widget-and-how-does-it-work) or the [WordPress plugin](/site/knowledgebase/installing-using-the-wordpress-plugin) on your website. * Supporters will see the donation field appear when they click "Donate" on whatever webpage(s) you've designated as a place where people can make contributions online. * If you are selling [tickets directly from your own website](/site/knowledgebase/what-is-the-widget-and-how-does-it-work), ticket buyers will have the option to add a donation to their ticket shopping cart.
![donation widget](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=311 "donation widget")
### Related Articles
* [As a Fiscally Sponsored Project, What Can I Do With Artful.ly?](/site/knowledgebase/as-a-sponsored-project-what-can-i-do-with-artful-ly)
Configuring Your 501(c)(3) Donations Kit & Donation Storefront

To configure the donations kit, make sure that you've activated the kit first. You can do this from your **Account Administration** page. Once you've done so, you're almost ready to accept donations to your organization! Just click on the blue **Configure** button below the kit to set your preferences. ![account administration detail](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=312 "account administration detail") ## Setting Up the Donation Storefront 1. Upload a **header image**. The image size is limited to 1MB. We recommend that your image be at least 300 pixels wide, and either a .jpg, .jpeg, .gif, or .png file format. This image can be changed at any time. 2. Describe your organization's activities, mission, and/or goals to potential patrons in the **About Your Organization** section. Add an image by uploading it from your computer. 3. Draft an appeal in the **Donation Ask for Storefront** section.  ![configure fields](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=594 "configure fields") 4. Choose a name for the **Navigation Button**. This can be customized to something like, "Give," "Support," or "Donate." 5. Add an appeal to shopping carts with the **Donation Nudge for Cart** section. You'll see default text in this space, but it can be customized. We recommend keeping it short and sweet. ![configure fields part 2](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=314 "configure fields part 2") 6. Add option for donors to include **special instructions.** This section appears in the cart so that a patron can add instructions for his or her gift to your organization. 7. Set up **Suggested Gifts**. This is optional. You also have the option to display an **open gift** field. Leaving this box checked allows donors to enter an amount of their choosing. 8. To add more levels, enter the **level name** and **$ amount** in the empty field and click add. New levels will only be added if every field is filled in. ![configure fields part 3](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=315 "configure fields part 3") 9. Add a **Thanks Message** and an **Email Message** that patrons will see when they've completed their order and in the confirmation email that they receive. Keep in mind that you'll still need to send them a tax receipt for their records. 10. Do you want the **Donation Storefront** to be visible in your **Central Storefront**? Check this last box before saving your details. This is optional, you don't need to make it public in order to take donations with the Artful.ly widget or on top of ticket orders. 11. While on the configure page, you can click on the donation storefront link to preview what it will look like.  Here's what a completed Donation Storefront could look like: ![sample donation storefront](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=316 "sample donation storefront") ### Related Articles * [How do I activate the 501(c)(3) Donation Kit?](/site/knowledgebase/enabling-donations-for-501-c-3-nonprofits) * [How Can My Fans Make Online Donations?](/site/knowledgebase/how-can-my-fans-make-online-donations) * [Donations & Donation Reports](/site/knowledgebase/donations-donation-reports)
Donations to Fiscally Sponsored Projects

**Artful.ly connects to your Fractured Atlas sponsored fund so that you can accept donations on top of ticket sales.** When people make a donation to your work via Artful.ly, that money will automatically show up in your fund balance on the Fractured Atlas website.
## Q: How do I connect my Artful.ly account to Fractured Atlas? **A:** Select the **connect now** link from your **Account Administration** page. **[Read here](/site/knowledgebase/connect-your-sponsored-project-and-artful-ly-accounty)** if you need help connecting.
## Q: What happens when a donor contributes via Artful.ly? **A: **The money from donations made via Artful.ly will show up immediately in your sponsored fund on the Fractured Atlas site. Those donations are treated like any other donation coming into your project via Fractured Atlas.
* Fractured Atlas takes 7% of the donation as an administrative fee. There are no extra credit card fees from Artful.ly for your donations. * Donations immediately show up in your current fund balance on the Fractured Atlas website, and become available for release after 7 calendar days. * Fractured Atlas will issue a tax receipt to your donors, which will be emailed to them immediately following their transaction. * If a patron buys a ticket and adds a donation at the same time, there will be two charges on their credit card statement—one for the ticket from "Artful.ly" and one for the donation "Fractured Atlas." * All donations are managed according to the [Fiscal Sponsorship guidelines](http://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/?do=manage) outlined in your Program Manual.
## Q: How do I get my donation money acquired through Artful.ly? **A:** Just submit a "Fund Release Request" via your My Fiscal Sponsorship page.
* If you'd like your Fractured Atlas donation money to go into the same bank account that your ticketing revenue goes to, fill out this [Fractured Atlas EFT Form](https://www.artful.ly/forms/artfully_etf_sign_up.pdf) and e-mail it to support@fracturedatlas.org. This way the money from your ticket sales and your donation money will end up in the same place, just at different times.
## Q: What about new donations by check or via the Fractured Atlas website? **A:** Any new donations that are logged in your sponsored fund history will be exported Artful.ly and recorded there too. Artful.ly checks for new donations in your sponsored fund every hour. When a new donor is imported into Artful.ly you can edit their contact information, add tags, and make notes on their Artful.ly People Record, but those changes will not be reflected on the Fractured Atlas side.
### Related Topics * [Artful.ly 101 For Fractured Atlas Fiscally Sponsored Projects](/site/knowledgebase/as-a-sponsored-project-what-can-i-do-with-artful-ly) * [Getting Started With Artful.ly](/site/knowledgebase/getting-started-with-artful-ly) * [Creating People Records, Actions, and Tags](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-create-a-new-people-record)
Donation Reports

This article covers how you retrieve donor information once it's in Artful.ly. For information on how your audience can make online donations, and how you can bring your donation history into Artful.ly check out these support articles:
- [How can my fans make online donations?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/how-can-my-fans-make-online-donations) - [Donation Imports](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/importing-donations) (For 501(c)(3) organizations) - [Converting a Ticket to a Donation](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/converting-a-ticket-order-into-a-donation) (For 501(c)(3) organizations) - [Donations to Fiscally Sponsored Projects](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/donations-to-fiscally-sponsored-projects)
Once you have donations in your Artful.ly there are a number of ways you can find your donations, gain new insights about your donor base, and work with that information.
## Donation Alerts
There are a couple ways that you can ensure you and your colleagues are notified when your organization receives a donation via Artful.ly.
- [Daily Sales Reports](/site/knowledgebase/daily-sales-report) are sent to the Organization Administrator and whomever else is listed as a recipient. This is a summary of all orders and donations made to your organization for the day. - Email alerts when a donation is made. From your **Account Administration** page under **Users**, the Organization Administrator can select who should receive an email notification when a patron donates to your organization. Read [Adding Users & Managing User Permissions](/site/knowledgebase/adding-users-managing-user-permissions-) for more detailed instructions.
## Advanced Search Searching for your donors through Advanced Search lets you looking for donors in combination with other useful information, like actions, ticket purchases, membership status, tags, and a whole lot more. Here's where you'll find out a lot more about your audience.
Advanced search is found in the people menu.
![A close up view of the people menu with an arrow pointing to Advanced Search](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=767 "advanced search")
From there you can build an advanced search for your desired donor search. ![An example of an advanced search for donations between 26 and 78 dollars](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=765 "Advanced Search for Donations") For more information on building your advanced searches check out these articles:
- [Advanced Search](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/advanced-search-list-segments) - [Advanced Search Conditions Glossary](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/advanced-search-conditions-glossary)
## Donation Reports Donation reports can get you a list of anyone who has donated during a certain time period, along with their order numbers and links to their order details.
This is often more convenient than an advanced search for when you just need everyone who's donated you in a certain time period. For example, order reports are very useful when you want to pull all donations from the last month so you can send out acknowledgment letters and tax receipts.
Donation reports can be found in the orders menu at the top of Artful.ly. Date ranges can be specified, and by using the work with button, you can export your report as a CSV to work with in another application.
![The donation reports page with an arrow pointing to where to find donation reports in the Orders menu](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=764 "donation reports")
## Exporting All Donations Sometimes you just need everything all at once. That's what exporting your donation list is for. Exporting all donations gives you essentially the same information as a donations report, but instead of a specific time period, you get every donation logged in your Artful.ly account.
![Export all donations option](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=766 "export donations")

* [Importing People](/site/knowledgebase/importing-people) * [Actions & The Action Feed](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed) * [Advanced Search and List Segments](/site/knowledgebase/advanced-search-and-list-segments)
Importing Donations

## How do I import Donations? Artful.ly makes it easy to add your old donation records to your Artful.ly account in one fell swoop. Just collect your donation records in a spreadsheet and follow these steps:
1. Go to **Reports**.
2. Select **Imports/Exports**.
![Imports and Exports](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=320 "imports and exports")
3. Select **Import Donations**.
4. Under the heading "Template" download an empty CSV file with appropriate headers for event imports. **Important: Your files must be in CSV (comma separated-values) format in order to upload them into Artful.ly. [Learn how to save an Excel file as a CSV here.](http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/excel-help/import-or-export-text-txt-or-csv-files-HP010099725.aspx)
5. Copy/paste the data from your old spreadsheet into the appropriate columns. Make sure to include all required fields as described under "Format".
![import donations](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=321 "import donations")
6. **Date and Donation type** are mandatory fields. If you don't have that data filled in, the import won't work. If you are missing this information, either leave that record out of your spreadsheet, or fill in the field with a place holder. For example ("company name", "company" could be a substitute for "first name", "last name")
7. When your CSV is ready, select **Choose File **under the header "Upload" and retrieve the file from your computer. Once you see the file name appear, you can select **Import**. It may take a few minutes for your contacts to be imported.
8. Once it has been processed (and there are no errors) you must **approve** the import. Depending on the size of the file, it may take a few minutes.
![approving imports](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=322 "approving imports")
## Importing Tips * **Make sure your column headers match those in the blank CSV.** If your file is not organized properly or the information is in the wrong place (email in the wrong column, for instance), you will receive an error message. We recommend you delete the file and adjust the spreadsheet appropriately before uploading it again. * **Observe usable values and date formatting. **Make sure you use the right terms (CASH or CREDIT CARD in Payment Methods for instance) when filling out your spreadsheet. Also, observe the specific formatting for dates so your donations are recorded on the right date. * **Tidy up your data in the CSV before you import it.** It's much easier to fix typos and formatting here doing it record-by-record in the app.
## Can I delete an import? It is not yet possible to delete a whole batch of imported donations. Please exercise a great deal of caution before importing a donation and make sure you double check your work.
### Related Articles * [Importing People](/site/knowledgebase/importing-people) * [Importing Events](/site/knowledgebase/importing-events) * [Exporting Data](/site/knowledgebase/exporting-data)
Artful.ly Donation Management Tips

##Logging Donations **If you are fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas you MUST log donations on the Fractured Atlas website.** They will be automatically synchronized into your Artful.ly account. Do not manually enter donations directly into your Artful.ly account. **If you are a 501(c)(3), the [501(c)(3) Donations Kit](/site/knowledgebase/enabling-donations-for-501-c-3-nonprofits) allows you to manually log a donation from a people record.** You should manually log any donations made via check, cash, another credit card processor, or in-kind donations. You do not need to enter donations made via an Artful.ly widget or Storefront--the system will automatically log those on the appropriate People record for you. To manually log a donation: 1. Find the donor's People record 2. Next to the Action Feed,select the **Add** button 3. Click the **Gave** button 4. Fill in the contribution details: * **Type:** Monetary, or In-kind. * **Payment**: Cash, Credit, Check, or Other. * **Deductible Amount**: Usually the total dollar amount given, or the monetary value of an in-kind donation. * **Non-Deductible Amount**: If the donor received a service or item in exchange for their gift, then the fair market value of that service or item is the non-deductible portion of the gift. * **Date and Time**: The date is important for your reporting purposes. You can estimate the time. * **Notes**: Use this to record any other information about this specific gift. ##Importing Donations 501(c)(3) charities can also import lists of past donations. [Read this article for instructions on importing donations.](/site/knowledgebase/importing-donations) ##Donation Alerts Donations are so exciting! You'll want to make sure that you know when they come in so you can do a happy dance and thank your donor right away. Artful.ly tells you when it receives a new donation in these ways: 1. **Recent Activity Feed on your Dashboard**: The feed on your Dashboard is a real-time bulletin of every interaction a patron has with your organization. It's good practice to skim this feed every time you login and see if you got any new donations. By the way, if you manually enter a past donation, it will calculate the time-stamp based on the date you entered in the contribution details. 2. [**Daily Sales Report Email**](/site/knowledgebase/daily-sales-report): An email is sent to your Organization Administrator and whomever she has listed as a recipient. This email summarizes all ticket sales and received donations from the previous day. 3. **Donation Alert Email**: An email is sent to the Organization Administrator and whomever she has listed as a recipient. This email is sent any time you receive a donation via Artful.ly The recipients of the aforementioned email reports can be selected by the account's Organization Administrator on the Account Administration page. ![Send user daily email](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=610 "Send user daily email") You can also use [Advanced Search](/site/knowledgebase/advanced-search-and-list-segments) to find donations made in a specific date range and/or dollar amount range. Or you can click Transactions, then Contributions in the top menu bar to see a list of all donations. ## Send Acknowledgements When someone makes a donation via Artful.ly, the donor will automatically receive an order confirmation email summarizing the transaction. In addition to this, you should mail or email your donors directly to thank them. They need this written acknowledgement to take a tax deduction for their donation. Thanking them in writing is also a chance to you to tell them what you're organization is up to and build a more substantial relationship with them. You don't want to forget to send this letter so we created a tool to make it easy for your to record when you sent that acknowledgement—just open up the donor's People record and [log a Hear Action](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed).  ### Related Articles * [Importing Donations](/site/knowledgebase/importing-donations) * [How do 501(c)(3)s receive donations with Artful.ly?](/site/knowledgebase/enabling-donations-for-501-c-3-nonprofits)
Why can't I find this donation my account?

If you can't find a donation that should be accounted for, here are a few ways to sleuth it out:
* **If you are fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas: **Artful.ly syncs with [Fractured Atlas donations](/site/knowledgebase/donations-to-fiscally-sponsored-projects) hourly, wait an hour and check again. * **If you were importing donations:** Make sure you approved the [import](/site/knowledgebase/importing-donations). * **If you are sure of the donation amount or time range:** Check the [Orders](/site/knowledgebase/transaction-history-sales-and-contributions)— maybe the donation was made under a different name. * **If you were manually entering a donation:** Make sure you saved it. [Manually entered donations](/site/knowledgebase/actions-the-action-feed) should show up right away in searches!
You may also want to backtrack to make sure that you should really be expecting the donation—maybe the donor hasn't even contributed yet!
Of course, if you're stuck, you can always [email us](mailto:support@artful.ly)!
What is the widget and how does it work?

## What is the widget?
The Artful.ly widget enables you to take donations and sell tickets directly from your own website; making a sleek shopping cart appear on your web page when someone clicks “Buy” or “Donate.”
The clean widget layout works with most web designs, which means ticket buyers don’t have to get directed off your site or bothered by ugly pop-ups. Meanwhile, your patrons' financial information is securely collected and transactions quickly processed.
Depending on what kits you have activated, you can create widgets for ticketing, donations, or both.
Note: The widget is designed to work on computers and not mobile devices. If a patron tries to purchase tickets through the widget using a phone or tablet, the patron will be redirected to complete the purchase in your organization's Artful.ly storefront. There is also a link in the widget to go to your Artful.ly storefront in case the patron has issues during checkout.
**Note: If you are have a WordPress hosted website, install the [Artful.ly WordPress Plugin](/site/knowledgebase/installing-using-the-wordpress-plugin) instead of the Widget.**
## Is the Widget easy to install?
**To install any Artful.ly widget, you must have a firm understanding of your site's markup language**. If you don't know HTML from a hat tree, we suggest you call your friendly website developer or use the automatically generated Artful.ly Storefronts to start selling tickets now.
## Current Version = 3.0
The current version of the widget is 3.0. If you are not running this version please remove your old widget code, generate code for a new widget, and re-install according to the instructions below.
## Installing a Widget
1. Generate the code for your custom widget by going to the top menu: Sell > Widgets. Or, from your Event Details menu: Share & Sell > On Your Site. 2. Choose whether to sell tickets, take donations, or both. 3. If you are selling tickets, choose the event you want to sell tickets to. 4. You will need jQuery on your site for any widget to work. If you don't already have jQuery installed, select "No, or don't know" and we'll add the jQuery install code to the widget code we give you. 5. Click **Generate Widget.** 6. Open the HTML editor for your website. 7. Copy paste all the code in the top gray box into the <head> tag of your website. 8. Copy paste all the code in the bottom gray box into the body of your page wherever you want the ticket selector or donation field to appear. 9. Save your webpage and test the widget.
![widget code generator](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=323 "widget code generator")
## What Your Patron Sees
Once your a patron has completed an order, the confirmation will appear on your website in the widget. They'll also be reminded to check their emails for their receipt.
![confirmation after checkout](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=324 "confirmation after checkout")
**Can I customize the widget on my site?**
**Where the widget appears on the page can be customized, as well as the font and style (CSS) of the widget button.** However the actual shopping cart that appears is not. Whatever content appears on your webpage besides the widget is up to you.
## Got any examples?
Sure thing!
**Real Live Widgets**
These are some links to users' sites with the widget installed. Try selecting a ticket or making a donation. These are live sites, so don't enter your credit card info unless you really intend to charge your card!
Donation Widgets
* [Breadbox Theater](http://www.breadboxtheatre.org/#!donate/c1xfj) * [Choral Composer/Conductor Collective](http://www.c4ensemble.org/support-c4.html) * [Fourth Arts Block](http://fabnyc.org/donate-fab) * [Eyebeam](http://eyebeam.org/donate)
Event Widgets
- [National Sawdust](http://nationalsawdust.org/event/alpenglow/) (Peruse their [events calendar](http://nationalsawdust.org/calendar/) to view the widget for various shows.) - [Shock Pulse](http://shockpulsela.com/event/neva-by-guillermo-calderon/)
**Fake Event Demo Widgets**
These two pages use the same event and same widget JavaScript and CSS from Artful.ly but the web site designer has styled them very differently so you can see the possibilities. You can go through the whole checkout process in these widgets by using this dummy credit card number: 4111111111111111. Name, billing address, valid expiration date, and csv code can be whatever you want.
* [Demo 1](https://www.artful.ly/widget-demo-1) * [Demo 2](https://www.artful.ly/widget-demo-2)
