What is an authorized user and who can become one?

An authorized user is a person who’s name is listed on a membership. For Community and Professional level memberships, there can only be one person listed. For Organization level membership, you can have up to three authorized users listed on the account. We can only share account-specific information with the authorized user(s) for that account. This is to protect the privacy of our members.
If you have an Organization level membership, there is a Master or “primary” user who is able to add or remove authorized users on the account. The Master user can make these changes by logging into the account at [www.fracturedatlas.org](http://www.fracturedatlas.org) and going to “My Stuff” → “Manage Users”.
If you signed up for membership and are working with another person who is going to the primary administrator of the account (e.g. they are going to be the one calling or emailing Fractured Atlas regarding the account), we ask that you either:
1) request to have the membership under their name
**OR**
2) upgrade to the Organization level of membership and add them as an authorized user.
What percentage of fiscal sponsorship applications do you approve?

This differs from month to month. We try to be as inclusive as possible, so the majority of the applications submitted each month are approved. Our staff reviews all applications before they go to our board for approval. If there are any questions or concerns about your application, our staff will be in touch and give you the opportunity to address those concerns or answer the remaining questions.
What are the fees for fiscal sponsorship?

Fractured Atlas takes a 7% administrative fee on all donations, with **no additional fees** for processing credit cards. As you raise funds over the lifetime of your project, **the fee is reduced**.
*These lower fees apply only to grants and donations by check*, but not to donations by credit card:
![enter image description here](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=592 "enter image title here")
This fee covers all costs associated with administering your fiscal sponsorship - including staff time, website maintenance, and bank fees. The fee also potentially represents a significant discount for smaller arts organizations in that, unless you have automated systems in place and dedicated staff to handle your accounting, the cost of tasks such as maintaining your 501(c)(3) status with the IRS and issuing tax receipts to donors can often eat up more than 7% of any given donation.
An important note about fees: In cases where Fractured Atlas is charged a fee by a vendor that is associated with your fund, we must pass that fee along to you. (An example of this would be a returned check fee.) Our staff will contact you if a situation like this occurs. Also, in certain cases, we may need to charge additional fees related to grants administration - those are explained in the Applying for Grants section of the Knowledge Base.
What are the different levels of membership? Which one's for me?

**Professional and Community Memberships** are for one person only - only the member can use our programs and services.
**An Organizational Membership** is for three people (you can add more to the membership at an additional fee) that are in the same organization. This organization does not need to be an LLC, nor does it need to be any type of established entity. If a group of you want to start a band and call yourselves ABC Rock Stars, then that's your organization, whether officially recognized or not. The members of the organization (beyond the lead member on the account when you sign up) will need to [register as Users](/site/members/prefs/?section=contact) on the account to be able to use our services (you can do so by having the lead member log into the website, click on "Settings," and then on "Users").
**A Community Membership** is a free single-user membership that allows you access to [Artful.ly](https://www.artful.ly/), [SpaceFinder](/site/spacefinder), [FracturedU](/site/prodev/fractured_u), [the calendar of events](/site/events/), and our [special offers](/site/specialoffers/).
**Please note**, if you are the sole person administering the Fractured Atlas membership and our services for your organization (meaning, no one else will need to log in to the website or contact us), then feel free to sign up for one of the single-user memberships. You only need to sign up for an Organizational Membership if multiple people will need their own login information and/or will need to contact us about the membership/our services.
Can I upgrade or downgrade my membership level?

Certainly, and at any time! If you would like to upgrade, you can do so directly through the website under the [My Stuff menu](/site/join/?do=upgrade_form) (or you can feel free to contact our office). To downgrade, you'll need to contact our office via email or phone. There is a cost associated with upgrading your membership since you'll be upgrading to a different membership payment level. There is no cost to downgrade levels, but you will not receive a refund for any dues already paid.
I have an Organizational Membership. How do I edit users?

To add authorized users to your Organization level account:
- Log into the FracturedAtlas.org using your username and password - Click on 'My Stuff' at the top left of the navigation bar - Select 'Manage Users' - You will be prompted to enter the name, email address, username, and password for any new users - The new user will be sent an email with login instructions - You can remove users on this same page by selecting the username and updating your account by clicking 'Disable User Account' - There is no limit to the total number of users on a Organization level account, however dues increase by $2.50/month per user above 3
Why are the funds released taxable income for me?

The Fractured Atlas fiscal sponsorship program is a grantor-grantee relationship and all funds released through our program are considered grants in the eyes of the IRS. The IRS has determined that all grant funds are considered taxable income under the tax law.
I'm not using the membership. Why am I still being charged?

Fractured Atlas sets each membership up to automatically re-bill each month as set forth in the terms and conditions of the [membership agreement](site/join/?do=display_terms). If you no longer wish to be a member with Fractured Atlas, you can switch your level of membership at any time by logging in to your account at www.fracturedatlas.org. If you do not cancel your membership online and have not requested via email or contact form to be switched to the free Community membership or to have your membership terminated, your card on file will continue to be charged.
Related Articles: How do I cancel my membership?
How do I set up electronic fund transfer (EFT)?

If you're a brand-new fiscally sponsored project looking to set-up direct deposit, or if you're an existing fiscally sponsored project trying to change direct deposit to a new checking account, you can download [the sign up form for electronic funds transfer (EFT) here.](/site/fiscal/EFT_Sign_Up.pdf)
When you fill out the form, keep in mind that we will also require supplemental documentation from the bank that confirms the account and routing numbers as well as the account holder name and address. The best way to confirm this info is with a voided check. Please note that we cannot accept temporary or starter checks and that the check must include your account and routing numbers as well as confirmation of the account holder name and address.
![Sample check showing account, banking, and routing numbers](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=497 "Screen shot of a check and its parts")
If you don't have checks for your account you may also be able to send us a letter from your bank, direct deposit verification (which you can usually download from your bank's website), or a scan of your most recent account statement (with any personal financial information blacked out).
You can send the completed EFT sign up form and voided check/account documentation via email to support@fracturedatlas.org. You can also fax it to 212-277-8025 or mail it to our address below.
**Fractured Atlas 248 West 35th Street, 10th Floor New York, NY 10001**
A fiscal sponsorship staff member will be in touch to confirm once the electronic fund transfer has been set-up.
Related Articles:
- [When and how do I get my project's funds?](/site/knowledgebase/when-and-how-do-i-get-my-project-s-funds) - [Will you do my taxes or bookkeeping?](/site/knowledgebase/will-you-do-my-taxes-or-bookkeeping)
How do I know if a donation is eligible for a tax receipt?

Fractured Atlas can accept and process donations made by check, debit/credit card, or noncash (in-kind) donations of physical tangible items contributed to your project.
You're welcome to accept cash donations, but these will need to be paid to you and your project directly and we cannot issue tax receipts for donations made by cash or money order.
Fractured Atlas uses the following IRS guidelines to determine whether or not we can issue a tax receipt.
- **Fully Deductible**: When a donor gives money to a charity and receives nothing in exchange for the gift, that donation is fully tax deductible to the extent permitted by law.
- **Partially Deductible**: When a donor gives money to a charity and receives goods or services in exchange (i.e. free tickets, a reception, a DVD, a t-shirt), s/he is only entitled to a tax-deduction for the amount donated above the value of the goods and services offered. In these cases, it is generally the recipient organization's responsibility to estimate the value of the items offered.
- **Sometimes Deductible**: When a donor gives tangible goods, the donation is tax-deductible based on the donor's estimate of the item's value. Office supplies, food, equipment, etc. are included in this category. NOTE: Fractured Atlas cannot accept or process vehicle donations (although a car does qualify as a tangible item).
- **Never Deductible**: When a donor gives pro-bono services (like fundraising, legal advice or graphic design) the donation is not considered tax-deductible according to the IRS. Free rent is also not considered tax deductible by the IRS, so donations of space are also not considered tax-deductible.
Related Articles:
- [Can you accept donations in the form of cash?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/can-you-accept-donations-in-the-form-of-cash) - [What is a "noncash" or "in-kind" donation?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-is-a-noncash-or-in-kind-donation)
What is a tagline?

A tagline is a brief, one-line description of your fiscally sponsored project. It is limited to 100 characters and will appear under your project title on your project’s public profile. You could also think of it as a catchy subtitle for your project.
![Example of a tagline from a fiscally sponsored project donation page](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=591 "Tagline")
I'm now at the Community level due to a billing failure.

I received a numberof emails saying that my billing failed and now I'm at the Community level of membership. Is there any way to get everything back to the way it was?
Of course! If you log in to your account at www.fracturedatlas.org, you can go to My Stuff --> Upgrade Membership. If you had a fiscally sponsored project, you will also need to either reply to the "F.S Project Termination" automated email you received or send a message to support@fracturedatlas.org to request that your project be re-activated.
Are Fractured Atlas membership dues tax-deductible?

Unfortunately, Fractured Atlas membership dues are not tax deductible. Though Fractured Atlas is a 501(c)(3) non-profit charity, your membership dues are not considered a contribution/donation. Can you write off your membership dues as a work-related expense? We suggest checking with your accountant to determine if this is possible.
Should my budget be projections or based on the last year?

Your budget will depend on whether or not you’re applying for ongoing or project-based activities to be fiscally sponsored. If you’re applying to have your ongoing activities fiscally sponsored, please provide an annual budget. This can reflect projections, which should absolutely be based on last year’s income and expenses.
If you’re applying for a one-off temporary project, then you should include your budget for that specific project. This can absolutely be projected, but you’re welcome to base it on what you’ve spent on similar projects.
If you want to learn more about creating a budget, check out this [webinar](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tNQAVT7GCFM).
I’ve been awarded a grant, now what do I do?

Congratulations! Please have the funder make the check payable to Fractured Atlas. The funder is welcome to send the check and award letter to you, but in most situations, these materials will be sent directly to Fractured Atlas. When we receive notification regarding a pending grant application, we will contact you as soon as we can to inform you of the funder’s decision.
**Who should sign the grant contract?**
Grant awards often require a contract of some kind and in most cases, this contract is to be signed by Fractured Atlas staff, not the sponsored project (since Fractured Atlas is the actual charity receiving the funds). Should you receive an award letter and grant contract, please contact our staff before signing the contract. In some cases, the sponsored project will be able to sign the contract instead of or in addition to a Fractured Atlas staff person.
Related articles:
- [What do I need to know about grant reports?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-do-i-need-to-know-about-grant-reports)
Should I apply for project or ongoing activities?

Do you have ongoing activities? If so, it’ll probably be simplest for you to apply for those ongoing activities. You will only be able to fundraise for the activities approved by our board. This means that if you apply for a one-off project, you will only be able to fundraise for those approved activities.
If you’d like to fundraise for more than one project, but you’ve only been approved for one, we will require you to submit an edited or expanded application with your new activities to be approved by our board. All of these edited application will fall into the regular review cycle along with the new applications for fiscal sponsorship. This means that it will be reviewed by our board the following month and you’ll be notified of approval by the 15th of that month.
What do I need to know about grant reports?

**Who submits the grant reports? **
It depends. In many cases, you will work directly with a fiscal sponsorship staff member to submit the report. Regardless of the case, please contact Fractured Atlas staff before submitting the report. At the very least, we’ll need to have a copy of the report on file.
**Are there any fees related to submitting a grant report? **
Similar to a grant application, we’ll designate 1 hour at no cost for grant reports. There are rare situations when elaborate or extensive documentation is required (usually when dealing with government funding agencies), and we may need to charge for our time in those cases. In these cases, we’ll charge the same $50/hr rate we charge for grant reviews.
What types of payment do you take for membership dues?

Currently, membership dues can be paid online by debit/credit. If you fiscally sponsored by us and have an available fund balance, you can contact our office about paying by fund release.
Sorry, we do not accept the following forms of payment for membership dues:
- cash - checks - money orders - PayPal - BitCoin
Am I required to do anything to keep my fiscal sponsorship?
You are required to pay your membership dues, complete all required Annual Reports, and adhere to our program policies as outlined in the program manual and fiscal sponsorship agreement.
Can I have your IRS Determination?

A Fractured Atlas staff member can authorize use of Fractured Atlas’s IRS determination letter in specific instances. These instances include, but are not limited to:
- Applying for a grant - Soliciting non-cash donations - Soliciting monetary donations - Nonprofit rates
**What if my situation does not fall into one of the above categories?**
Please contact us if your individual situation does not fall into one of the above categories. We’ll work with you to figure out whether or not it is appropriate to use our IRS determination for your specific situation.
**How do I obtain permission to use your IRS determination?**
Please contact us to seek permission to use our IRS determination letter. We allow use of our IRS determination on a case by case basis so when contacting us, we’ll need to know:
- Who is asking for it? What is her/her/its address? - Why are they asking for it? - Is there an application involved? - Is there a contract involved? - When is it needed?
**How long will it take for you to send Fractured Atlas’s IRS determination?**
It really depends on the situation. It could take us 1 business day if it is for a simple donation that does not require an application or anything else, or it could take us 10 business days if it is for a grant, in which case we’ll need to review and approve the grant application. In all cases, please let us know when you need the IRS determination and we’ll try to email it to you by that date. Please do leave a few days for back and forth in case we have some questions about your situation.
**Note:** The Fractured Atlas staff reserves the right to deny permission for use of Fractured Atlas’s IRS determination. Using the IRS determination in a specific situation without written permission for that situation is a prohibited activity of our program and is grounds for termination of your fiscal sponsorship.
How much does membership cost?

Community Membership = Free for one authorized user
Professional Membership = $10/month for one authorized user
Organization Membership = $20/month for up to three authorized users
If you'd like to have more than three people on your membership, you can add additional members to an Organizational Membership at the rate of $2.50/month per additional member.
I can no longer afford dues, but would like to remain a member.

We're sorry to hear you are in a difficult financial situation. In some special cases, Fractured Atlas staff can approve a free extension of membership. We would hate to lose you, but please understand that we are a nonprofit organization and can only offer extensions in special cases.
Please contact our our office via email or phone to discuss extension possibilities. You can also consider switching to a free Community Membership, though you will lose access to some of our most popular services. But, you would still remain a member of the Fractured Atlas community.
Can an international artist apply for fiscal sponsorship?

Yes, we can sponsor any entity (meaning an individual or a business) that has a United States IRS issued TIN (taxpayer identification number) AND a valid U.S. mailing address that is checked frequently. As long as you are set up to pay taxes and receive mail, you can join our sponsorship program.
I received notice that my membership dues didn't go through.

We email all members if their credit card does not go through. Your credit card information is either outdated or the card you're using is over its limit. You can update your credit card billing information by:
- Calling our office with new payment information, or
- Updating it online by logging in and going to "[Billing Info/History](Billing Info/History)" under the My Stuff menu.
Will I get a receipt when my dues are paid?
Yes. Once your credit/debit card is charged for your membership dues, an email receipt will be sent to the address you have on file with us.
How long does my fiscal sponsorship stay active?

Your sponsorship will exist in perpetuity as long as your membership remains current and you've completed any required Annual Reports. You may terminate your sponsorship at any time as long as you have completed any required Annual Reports.
Can I have more than one fiscal sponsor?

No, we do not operate an exclusive fiscal sponsorship program; however, some other fiscal sponsors do, so always be sure to ask when inquiring about their program. Our projects are allowed to have more than one fiscal sponsor.
Why would I want to have more than one fiscal sponsor?

Sometimes our projects have another fiscal sponsor due to geographic restrictions of a funder. For example, if a funder in the Bay Area will only allow grants to go to a fiscal sponsor in the Bay Area, a project might need to get a second fiscal sponsor in that area.
Do you give donors refunds if my project is not completed?

Legally, we are required to ensure that donations made for the purposes of a project are used towards those activities. We are a charity and we have certain responsibilities to donors and to the IRS to fulfill a donor's expectations of how a gift will be used once a donation has been made. If a project cannot fulfill its plans, we suggest that you use any funds you have raised to cover all associated project expenses (even if it didn't yield a finished product, there are usually expenses incurred along the way that you can use your funds to pay). We cannot simply issue a fund release to you without a project related expense.
What is fiscal sponsorship?

Fiscal sponsorship is a fundraising tool that enables an individual, group of individuals, or organization to raise funds using some of the benefits of a 501(c)(3) organization.
To dig a little deeper, our fiscal sponsorship program is technically what is called a *grantor-grantee relationship*. This means that an individual, business, government agency, or foundation contributes money for a sponsored artist, project, or organization to Fractured Atlas which then grants the money to the sponsored entity for project-related expenses.
One reason fiscal sponsorship exists is because most private foundations are unable to make grants directly to individuals. Public 501(c)(3) charities (like Fractured Atlas), on the other hand, are generally able to give grants directly to individuals. Hence, fiscal sponsorship allows a foundation to grant the money to a charity sponsoring a project they want to support that is lacking its own exempt status and then the charity can grant that money to the project.
Fractured Atlas fiscally sponsors artistic projects that are not-for-profit in nature and have a benefit to the public.
Related Articles:
- [Will you raise money for me?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/will-you-raise-money-for-me) - [What questions are in the fiscal sponsorship application?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-questions-are-in-the-fiscal-sponsorship-application)
What's the difference between membership and fiscal sponsorship?

You must be a member of Fractured Atlas to take advantage of our services and programs. Since fiscal sponsorship is one of our programs, you must be a member to use it. Please note that Community Members are restricted from using our fiscal sponsorship program.
Before you can apply for fiscal sponsorship, you must sign up as a member of Fractured Atlas at one of our dues-paying levels - either the Professional level ($10/month) or Organization level ($20/mo).
The only difference between the two membership levels is the number of user accounts that you get. If you only need one user account, you can still sign up at the Professional level even if you're applying for fiscal sponsorship on behalf of your company.
The Organization level of membership gives you up to three users, so you can have three authorized contacts on your account. We are only able to share sensitive information or instructions regarding your fiscal sponsorship to authorized users on your membership, so if you plan to have multiple people interacting with us, you will need to join at the Organization level.
Please refer to our [Privacy Policy](/site/about/privacy) for more info.
You're welcome to switch back and forth between our different levels of membership at any time. Any questions regarding your membership can be directed to our staff.
How can I get a business bank account if I am not incorporated?

**You are not required to have a business bank account**, but we *STRONGLY* suggest you have a separate bank account for your project. This means you can simply open a separate personal checking account.
To open any bank account, we suggest approaching a local bank to inquire about what is required to open such an account. Keep in mind that smaller, independent banks (or better yet, non-profit credit unions) often charge the lowest fees and provide better customer service than the large corporate banks. ### Business Bank Accounts
**If you'd like to open a business bank account,** filing a Certificate of Assumed Name (aka DBA Doing Business As) with your County Clerk's office is usually enough for an individual who has not incorporated a business to open a business bank account as long as an individual is willing to personally guarantee the account. We *WILL NOT* provide you with our IRS Determination letter to open a bank account.
Some banks may require official documents stating that the business entity exists (Articles of Incorporation, Bylaws, etc) but if you hunt around, you can probably find a bank that will help you out – after all, they are in business to take people’s money. Again, you are not required to have a business account, you can also open a separate personal checking account, so long as your own personal finances are not involved.
Setting up a separate bank account for your business activities makes tax reporting easier and establishes a financial history for the project/company.

While we provide easy-to-use online tools to help you manage funds raised through your fiscal sponsorship, *we do not provide comprehensive bookkeeping services* and strongly recommend that you use the services of an accountant. [Check here for referrals for potential accountants.](/site/fiscal/page/accounting_resources)
Also, check out our [brief tax sheet for more information.](/site/fiscal/Fiscal_Sponsorship_Tax_Information.pdf)

Posting a Listing on the Special Offers & Discount Page

If you have a discount on a service or special offer you'd like to make available to Fractured Atlas members, you can create a listing on Fractured Atlas's Special Offers and Discounts page.
To do this simply: 1. Log in to the Fractured Atlas website with your username and password. If you don't have an account, you can sign up for a free Community-level membership, [here](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/join/). 2. Navigate to the [Special Offers and Discounts Page](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/specialoffers/). 3. Click the "Add Listing" tab at the top of the page. 4. Fill out and submit the form.
Once you do this, your request will be sent to Fractured Atlas staff for evaluation and approval. After it's approved it will appear live on the website!
How do I sign up for membership through the Open Arts Network?

If you are associated with an [Open Arts Network](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/oan/) partner, you may be eligible to sign up for a free year of Professional-level membership to Fractured Atlas (and half off membership dues after the first year)! To see what groups are participating in the Open Arts Network, you can find a list [here](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/oan/).
If you are associated with a participating organization, simply contact the organization and ask for the link for their custom membership sign-up page. Once you get the link from the participating organization, you can sign up by filling in the form on the custom membership sign-up page.
Can my organization join the Open Arts Network?
We're always looking for
Do you ever refund donations?

As a general principle, donations are presumed by law to be irrevocable gifts unless otherwise specified in a grant agreement or other contract. This is an important legal concept that, among other things, permits gifts to be tax-deductible. That said, when a donation was clearly made by mistake (for example, if a donor accidentally made duplicate online gifts or typed in the wrong amount when donating online), we will happily refund the erroneous charge.
Related Articles:
- [What happens if a donor disputes a credit card charge?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-happens-if-a-donor-disputes-a-credit-card-charge) - [Do you give donors refunds if my project is not completed?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-happens-if-a-donor-disputes-a-credit-card-charge)
Can you accept donations in the form of cash?

Unfortunately, the answer is no. We cannot accept and process donations of cash because they do not provide a paper trail back to an individual. Without a paper trail, there is no way to certify that the person receiving the tax receipt is the donor. We must be very strict about this since we can get in big trouble with the IRS if we issue receipts to donors who didn't actually contribute to us.
- [How do I know if a donation is eligible for a tax receipt?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-know-if-a-donation-is-eligible-for-a-tax-receipt)
How do I process donations made by check?

Please follow these instructions for check donations, to ensure that your donors' contributions are correctly processed for the purposes of your project:
1. Have your donors make checks payable to Fractured Atlas.
2. Your donors should then mail those checks to you directly, so that you can report them on your My Fiscal Sponsorship page using the online donation report form.
3. Within two weeks of receiving the checks and reporting them online, you should mail them to our office for processing. Our address is:
Fractured Atlas Attn: Fiscal Sponsorship 248 West 35th Street 10th Floor New York, NY 10001
4. We process check donations within a business day of receiving them in our office. Upon processing, we generate tax receipts and send them to you by e-mail. You are then responsible for forwarding those tax receipts to your donors, along with your thanks.
5. For check donations of $1,000 or more, we require a Major Gift Letter which can be downloaded as a PDF on our website.
**Please note:** Checks that are sent directly from the donor to the Fractured Atlas office may be mailed back to you or the donor.
Related Articles:
- [How do I report donations made by check?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-report-donations-made-by-check) - [What is the Major Gift Letter?](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/knowledgebase/what-is-the-major-gift-letter)
How do I report donations made by check?

For donations made by check, you must report these contributions on your My Fiscal Sponsorship page before forwarding on to us for processing.
1. Log-in to our website and go to your My Fiscal Sponsorship page.
2. Under the Donations button, click the "Report" link below "Checks."
3. Select an existing donor from the dropdown menu or create a record for a new donor. A mailing address is required for the purposes of the tax receipt that we issue.
4. If you've created Giving Levels on your fiscal sponsorship online profile, you will be able to select the applicable Giving Level from a dropdown menu under 'Donation Information.' If you haven't set up Giving Levels, no dropdown menu will appear.
5. Be sure to include a "Non-deductible portion" for contributions where you award the donor goods/services in exchange for their donation. The non-deductible portion is the fair market value of the rewards that you are offering to your donors.
6. If the donation is for $1000 or more, you will be able to upload a signed Major Gift Letter to the donation report form. If your donor has yet to complete the Major Gift Letter, you are not required to upload a document in order to submit the report, but the donation will not be available for you to request until we receive the signed letter. The form letter is available for download from your My Fiscal Sponsorship page under Donations.
7. The 'special notes' field is for you to add a memo to the donation report for your own future reference.
8. Click 'Report Donation.' You will need to submit a separate donation report for each check that you've received.
What is the Major Gift Letter?

As a 501(c)(3) organization, Fractured Atlas must submit itself to an annual, third-party audit. Our auditors have required that we have an extra layer of documentation on hand for large check donations in order to show that Fractured Atlas is adhering to our donor's wishes. Hence, the Major Gift Letter. You can [download](/site/fiscal/download_major_gift_letter) the Major Gift Letter from the My Fiscal Sponsorship section of the website.
We're happy to process check donations of $1,000 or more without a Major Gift Letter, but these funds will not be available for you to request until we receive a completed letter.
Credit card donations do not require a Major Gift Letter. We can accept credit card donations up to $20,000 per transaction.
What is an Annual Report and why do I have to file one?

We require that all projects annually report to us on how they spent the funds we disbursed to them because of our obligations to the IRS as an exempt organization.
Your Annual Report should detail what you did with the funds we gave you specifically for the calendar year from January 1st until December 31st. The Annual Report form is another online form that we provide via our website (accessible only when logged in). It contains a narrative section and a budget form that all projects must complete. If you have kept decent records, it shouldn't take more than 15 - 30 minutes to do this.
Any project that does not complete an Annual Report by the deadline will have its fund frozen until it is completed. If your fund is frozen, Fractured Atlas will not accept donations for your project and you will not be able to release funds.
What is a "noncash" or "in-kind" donation?

Any kind of item or service can be donated in-kind. Donations of tangible goods (meaning something you can touch) are considered NONCASH donations by Fractured Atlas. We can accept almost any type of donated noncash item for the purposes of a project and issue a receipt to the donor for the item.
The one exception is vehicle donations, which we do not have the facilities to process in accordance with IRS regulations. Donations of intangible services (like pro-bono accounting/legal help or free rent of any kind) are considered IN-KIND donations by Fractured Atlas. These donations are very valuable but are not tax deductible under the law and therefore, we cannot issue a receipt for donations of pro-bono services or free space.
![A chart that breaks down what we can accept for noncash donations](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=499 "What noncash donations are tax-deductible?")
Why is my fund frozen and what does that mean?

Most likely it means that you did not complete your Annual Report for the last calendar year. When a fund is frozen, we will not release any monies to the project until the annual report has been filed. Donations cannot be made to the project while a fund is frozen and you can't release funds. [Submit your annual report](/site/fiscal/?do=manage) and we will unfreeze your project after it is reviewed.
How do I report noncash donations?

Here are the steps for reporting noncash donations to our fiscal sponsorship program for the purposes of issuing a tax receipt.
1. Before you report donations of non-monetary property, please have your donor complete the Noncash Donation letter. If their contribution is valued at $250 or more, we will require that you take a photograph of the donated item(s). For donations of $5000 or more, we will require than an appraisal be conducted on the donated items. 2. Log-in to our website and go to your My Fiscal Sponsorship page.
3. Under the Donations button, click the "Report" link below "Non-Monetary Property."
4. Select an existing donor from the dropdown menu or create a record for a new donor. A mailing address is required for the purposes of the tax receipt that we issue.
5. As with all donations that we process for the purposes of our fiscally sponsored project, we charge a 7% administrative fee. For noncash donations, this fee is assessed off of the stated value of the donated item(s). We can deduct the administrative fee on noncash donations from your available fund balance or you can select 'Use credit card on file to pay admin fee' and we will charge the 7% fee to your card once the donation is processed by a fiscal sponsorship staff member.
6. You will be able to upload the Noncash Donation Letter and, if applicable, the photo of the donated item(s) if the contribution is valued at $250 or more. One or both of these items will be required before the fiscal sponsorship team can process the contribution and issue a tax receipt.
7. The 'special notes' field is for you to add a memo to the donation report for your own future reference.
8. Click 'Report Donation.' You will need to submit a separate donation report for each donation of non-monetary property that you've received.
What kind of information can I get about my fund & donors?

We provide each project with a [Donation History page](/site/fiscal/fund_history?type[]=Donation), which contains a sortable list of your entire history of donors, the date and amount they gave. On this page, you can view the donor's contact information but you cannot edit it. If you notice an incorrect address in your donation history, simply contact our staff with the correct information and we will update our records.
We also recommend projects use Artful.ly as a CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system. It's free to use and syncs with a project's fiscal sponsorship donation history.
How do I release funds?

Once you have set up [electronic funds transfer (EFT)](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-set-up-electronic-fund-transfer-eft), you can request funds for upcoming expenses or for reimbursement by submitting a Fund Release Request through our website.
To request funds, you'll need to follow the below steps:
![Screenshot showing the My Fiscal Sponsorship page with "Release Funds" highlted with an arrow](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=593 "Release Funds Screenshot")
1. Log on to www.fracturedatlas.org, 1. Click "My Fiscal Sponsorship," 1. Click "Fund Releases," 1. Click "Request Funds," 1. Select the line items that correspond with your expenses from the drop down menu and indicate how much you're requesting for each line item in the accompanying field. *Please include multiple expenses in one fund release request.*
Once we approve the request, the funds will post to your bank account within 1-3 business days.
Related Articles:
- [How do I set up electronic fund transfer (EFT)?](/site/knowledgebase/how-do-i-set-up-electronic-fund-transfer-eft) - [Why do I have to tell Fractured Atlas my expenses?](/site/knowledgebase/why-do-i-have-to-tell-fractured-atlas-my-expenses) - [How long does it take to get money out of my fund?](/site/knowledgebase/how-long-does-it-take-to-get-money-out-of-my-fund)
What happens if a donation check bounces?

It rarely ever happens, but if it does, the donation amount will be reduced from the sponsored project's available funds and we will also deduct any bank fees we incur from the bounced check. When this happens, we will immediately contact the project to alert them of the situation.
How long do I have to wait until my funds are available?
All donations are subject to a 7-day holding period before they are made available for release. Once they are available, you can [request the funds](/site/fiscal/fund_release).
What happens if a donor disputes a credit card charge?

Occasionally, a donor disputes a credit card charge from Fractured Atlas due to not recognizing it. If the sponsored project has funds available to cover the disputed donation, we will refund the original transaction and alert the project of the refund. If the project does not have enough funds to cover the disputed donation, we will contact the donor directly and ask him/her to withdraw the dispute. If we do not hear back from the donor or the donor does not withdraw the dispute, we will refund the original transaction and reduce the available funds.
To prevent disputes, please make sure to email donors after they give to thank them and remind them that a charge from Fractured Atlas is going to show up on their credit card.
How long does it take to get money out of my fund?

Fund Release Requests are approved by electronic fund transfer (EFT) every week day that the Fractured Atlas office is open. We can generally approve most fund release requests within one business day and then the funds will post to your bank account in 1-3 business days. This process could be delayed if we need further information about your request or if we request additional back-up documentation.
Can you accept donations of stock?

We can accept these donations but they involve a little more work than a normal gift. If you have a donor who wants to make a donation of this kind, please [contact our staff](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org).
What is Indiegogo?

[Indiegogo](http://indiegogo.com) is an international crowdfunding site founded by Danae Ringelmann, Slava Rubin, and Eric Schell in 2008. Its headquarters are in San Francisco, California. The site was founded in 2008 and was one of the first sites to offer crowd funding. Indiegogo allows people to solicit funds for an idea, charity or start-up business. The site’s goal is to empower anyone that has an idea to be able to raise the funds and amplify their goal.
How do I end or terminate my fiscal sponsorship?

Your sponsorship may exist in perpetuity as long as your membership remains active and your project is in good standing. When the time comes for you to end the sponsorship, there are two ways to close out your sponsored fund.
- **Terminate:** If you terminate your membership with Fractured Atlas, your fiscal sponsorship will also be terminated, since membership is a requirement of sponsorship. If you terminate your membership before you have submitted your Annual Report, you are still required to submit an Annual Report. Our staff can answer any questions about this.
If you have funds left when you terminate, a staff member will contact you about next steps.
- **Expire:** If you have completed your project and want to maintain your membership with Fractured Atlas, please contact support@fracturedatlas.org. We have the ability to “expire” your project in our system once you have submitted your final Annual Report. Marking a project “expired” in our database allows you the ability to apply for a new project in the future.
What happens to remaining funds if I end my membership?

If there are leftover funds when a fiscal sponsorship terminates, the project will be able to request those funds up to 90 days after the termination date. These funds can be released for qualified, project related expenses. If the funds are not claimed within 90 days of the termination, they will be redirected to support the overhead of the fiscal sponsorship program. We will send you several emails asking you to claim the funds during the 90 day window.
I'm interested in the Indiegogo/Fractured Atlas partnership.

Fractured Atlas has a partnership with [Indiegogo](http://www.indiegogo.com), which allows our fiscally sponsored projects to use Indiegogo’s crowdfunding platform, and still accept tax-deductible donations. Fractured Atlas will receive all of the donations throughout the course of the campaign, and the donations are assessed the Fractured Atlas 7% administrative fee plus a 3% fee from Indiegogo, regardless of whether or not the campaign’s goal is met. All credit cards that are processed on the Indiegogo website are charged through PayPal. Indiegogo charges a 3% fee and Fractured Atlas charges a 7% administrative fee. **Please keep in mind that each donation received through the Fractured Atlas-Indiegogo partnership is charged a 10% fee in total.** In order for this to work, the Indiegogo campaign will need to be directly linked to your fiscally sponsored project.
Does fiscal sponsorship help with matching gifts?

Yes! In most cases, we can accept and process matching gifts from businesses whose employees make a contribution to us for the charitable purposes of your project. However, matching gift programs have their own rules about the charities and programs they will support and their rules trump our willingness to accept the gift. Any specific questions about how to process a matching gift can be [directed to our program staff](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org).
Why do I have to tell Fractured Atlas my expenses?

It is a best practice of fiscal sponsors to provide oversight for the funds processed through their fiscal sponsorship programs. The oversight is necessary to confirm that the funds are being used for appropriate expenses related to the charitable activities that were approved by the fiscal sponsor’s board. A charity cannot spend funds for purposes unrelated to their mission, so a fiscal sponsor needs to make sure the funds released to its fiscally sponsored projects are being used in a charitable way. Fractured Atlas provides oversight in three ways:
1. We require a breakdown of expenses when the funds are requested. 1. We ask for fund release documentation and require it in some cases. 1. We require an annual report from anyone who has released funds throughout the year.
How do I connect to Indiegogo?

**If you’ve never run an [Indiegogo](http://www.indiegogo.com) campaign:**
1. *Log on* to [www.fracturedatlas.org](www.fracturedatlas.org) and go to your My Fiscal Sponsorship page.
2. *Click “Accessorize!”* and you’ll see a list of services to which you can link your fiscal sponsorship.
3. *Click “Indiegogo”* (click it again), and a sidebar will appear containing information about Indiegogo and its partnership with Fractured Atlas.
4. *Click “Create a NEW campaign on Indiegogo.”* When you click this link, an account and draft campaign will be automatically created for you on Indiegogo.com. Please check for an email from Indiegogo which outlines the steps you will need to take in order to access your Indiegogo account and campaign.
5. *Create your campaign!* For tips about creating a successful campaign, please [click here](site/blog/2012/09/26/tips-and-tools-crowdfunding/). You can also check out [Indiegogo's Help Center](https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us). Please remember to include the values for each perk in the field labeled, “non tax-deductible amount,” on the edit page of your campaign.
6. *Click “Review & Launch”* once your campaign is complete and you’re ready for us to review it. Fractured Atlas will receive an email notification alerting us that you’re ready to have your campaign reviewed and approved. We’ll review it within 5 business days (though we can usually review it within 1-2), and we’ll approve it if we think it’s ready to go. Once approved, the campaign will go live immediately. If we have questions or edits for the campaign, we’ll reach out to you directly by email to address our concerns.
**If you’ve run an Indiegogo campaign that was linked to Fractured Atlas:**
1. *Create a new campaign* using the Indiegogo account you’ve used for your Fractured Atlas campaigns in the past.
2. *[Contact us](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org)* with the URL for your draft campaign and we’ll take the necessary steps to have it connected to your fiscal sponsorship. Please make sure to do this before clicking “Review & Launch” so that we can review the campaign while it is still in draft mode.
3. *Add non-deductible amounts as necessary.* This field will not appear until after your campaign has been manually linked to your fiscally sponsored project.
4. *Click “Review & Launch”* once your campaign is complete and we’ll proceed as above.
**If you’ve run an Indiegogo campaign outside of your Fractured Atlas fiscal sponsorship:**
1. *Log on* to www.fracturedatlas.org and go to your My Fiscal Sponsorship page.
2. *Click “Accessorize!”*
3. *Click “Indiegogo”* (click it again), and a sidebar will appear containing information about Indiegogo and its partnership with Fractured Atlas.
4. *Click “Connect to an EXISTING Indiegogo Account,”* and enter the email address associated with your Indiegogo account in the pop-up. If you’ve already started creating a campaign, this should automatically link the campaign draft to your fiscal sponsorship. If you have not started creating a campaign, go ahead and put together a draft and [contact us](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org) with the URL so we can have it manually linked to your project. Once it’s linked, go ahead and add any relevant non-deductible amounts for the perks.
5. *Click “Review & Launch”* once your campaign is complete and (you guessed it) we’ll proceed as above.
It is very important that your campaign is linked to Fractured Atlas or we will not be able to process the donations and they will not be tax-deductible. If you are ever concerned about whether or not your campaign is successfully linked to Fractured Atlas, please [email us](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org) and we’ll gladly let you know. Unfortunately, if the campaign is not linked, there’s no way for us to know it exists, so we’ll rely on you to let us know about any subsequent campaigns you run.
**How can I tell if my Indiegogo campaign is connected to my fiscal sponsorship?**
If you do not see one of these clues, then your campaign is probably not connected to Fractured Atlas and you should [contact us](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org) with the URL for your campaign.
1. *Check for the Fractured Atlas logo.* If your campaign is linked to your fiscal sponsorship, the Fractured Atlas logo will appear above your perks.
2. *Check for the Fractured Atlas Standard Text.* The standard text will appear above campaign description that you’ve created for the campaign.
3. *Check for the “non tax-deductible amount.” *If your campaign is linked, then a field marked “non tax-deductible amount” will appear below the “Contribution Amount” field for each perk on your campaign’s edit page.
Once you’re sure your campaign is connected to your fiscally sponsored project and we’ve approved it, you’re as good as golden!
My fiscal sponsorship is terminated; how do I reactivate it?

If your fiscal sponsorship was terminated because you changed your membership to our free Community membership, or if you were downgraded for nonpayment of dues, we will first need you to upgrade back to a dues-paying level of membership. [You can take care of that here.](/site/join/?do=upgrade_form)
![Screenshot showing menu option to Upgrade Membership](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=502 "Screenshot showing upgrade membership option")
Then, if you wish to obtain fiscal sponsorship for a *NEW PROJECT*, you can click ['Apply for Sponsorship'](/site/fiscal/?do=apply_instructions) on our website's homepage.
Alternately, if you wish to reinstate your fiscal sponsorship for an *ALREADY-APPROVED PROJECT*, please [contact the fiscal sponsorship staff here](/site/helpdesk) to request that we reactivate your sponsorship.
Can I get nonprofit rates from vendors if I am fiscally sponsored?

It depends on the vendor, but in most cases the answer is YES. In order to get a nonprofit rate, simply send our staff all of the contact information for the vendor and we will send you a Nonprofit Rate Request letter that you can give to the vendor when asking for the discounted rate.
What are the limitations of fiscal sponsorship?

There are a few things you can't do with fiscal sponsorship:
- You can't apply to certain funding sources that only accept applications from exempt organizations and disallow applications from fiscal sponsors (like the NEA). - You cannot get a nonprofit bulk mailing rate. - You cannot accept vehicle donations (the IRS restrictions governing how vehicle donations must be processed are incompatible with our program). - You cannot submit a fund release request for expenses incurred before your project was approved by our board. - You cannot use Fractured Atlas's sales tax exempt certificate for purchases.
Other than that, you can take advantage of many benefits that are normally afforded to an exempt organization.
I would like to contact other members.

**Finding Other Members**
Click on [Member Directory](/site/members/) under the Community link at the top of the website. From there, you can peruse information that other Fractured Atlas members have listed in their public profiles. You can search by name, artistic discipline, or any other tidbit of information that you're interested in. Please note that not every member has a public profile and, if they do, it might not always be updated with recent information. Still, it's a good way to find out about other Fractured Atlas members.
**Contacting Other Members**
It is possible to view other members at Fractured Atlas, but we do not provide a mechanism to email all of them. If you'd like to get the word out about an event, simply post it to the [Calendar of Events](/site/events/).
If you find a specific member you'd like to contact through our Member Directory, you have the ability to contact them by following these steps:
1. Click on "Send a private message" beneath their Member Profiles. 1. An alert that they have a private message will be sent to the email address they have on file with us. 1. Should their email address be current, and should they wish to contact you in return, you will receive an alert in your own inbox stating that the member has replied to your private message. Simply click on the link in the email, log in to the website, and you can view the message.
As we hold our members' personal privacy sacred, we do not give out member phone numbers, mailing addresses, or email addresses. If you cannot locate a member through our Member Directory and would like to initiate contact with a specific member, please call our office. We can contact the member on your behalf and provide them with your contact information.
How do I upload images into my Image Gallery?

Each Fractured Atlas member is entitled to set up an Image Gallery with photos of their work (any type of artwork is allowed). To do so, you have to:
1. Create a Flickr account first at [www.flickr.com](http://www.flickr.com) 1. Upload your photos to that 1. Once you have a Flickr account with photos, you can log into our website and go to "Member Profile" under the My Stuff menu 1. To add photos, click on the Photos tab and enter your Flickr information. Your Flickr photos will automatically upload in seconds.
I set up my Gravatar account, but my profile image isn't showing.

For your Gravatar to appear on the website, you have to be using the same address as the one that you set up your membership with. Make sure to check which email address you signed up with for Gravatar and for Fractured Atlas. Once the two email addresses match, your profile image should appear.
Can I switch my membership into someone else's name?

###Can I switch my membership into someone else's name?
Certainly. To do so, please have the original member [emai](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org)l or call our office with the new member's contact and payment information. There is no cost to do this.
How do I update my membership info?

###How do I update the personal information (including payment and login information) you have on file for me?
The best way is to log into the website (using your username and password) and click on "Billing Info/History" under the My Stuff menu. You can also feel free to call or email our office.
I just Googled myself and found my name on your website!

This is a result of the Member Profile function on our site. To remove your information, simply log into the website and go to "My Stuff" --> "Edit Profile." Remove any information that you do not wish to be public. If you need to change your username, you can do that there as well. Please note, you can only change your username once.
What is a Member Profile? How do I create one?

Each Fractured Atlas member is entitled to set up a Member Profile, which lists general information about themselves and their art. Other members (and non-members) can search and view these profiles. It's a great way to network and make yourself known. If you'd like to create a Member Profile, log into the website with your username and password, then go to the My Stuff menu and click on "Member Profile."
I am not able to log in to my account. Help!

###I am not able to log in to my account. Help!
Don't worry! Simply click "Login" on our website. On the next screen, you'll see a hyperlink that says "I Forget!" Click that, then enter the email address you signed up with. A few minutes later, your username and a new temporary password will be sent via email. We highly recommend resetting this temporary password once you log in (you can do so under the My Stuff menu) as it will eventually expire. If you're still having problems after trying this, please contact our office. It will be helpful if you provide this information to us when you send us a message:
1) What browser/version of browser you are using
2) What, if any, error messages you received
3) If you have any other Fractured Atlas membership accounts
I’m trying to re-activate my membership, but I’m getting an error message about an amount having to be more than zero!
Why did I get a notice about a billing problem?

###My credit card number is definitely the same. Why did I get an email notice about a billing problem?
The most common reason this happens is that the expiration date of the card has changed, but has not yet been updated in our system. Please log into your account and go to My Stuff -> Billing Info/History to ensure all your details are up-to-date. The page will show you the last four digits of the card you have on file, as well as the expiration date and billing zip code. If all the details are the same as your current card, please contact us to run the card again for dues payment.
My partner has a membership. I have questions about the account.

Great! We would love to answer your questions, but unless you are an authorized user on the account, we won’t be able to share any private information regarding the account’s details with you over the phone or by email. Please have the member contact us or have them add you as an authorized user.
Can I reactivate my membership once I've cancelled?

Certainly - and at any time! You can do this by:
- Clicking on the Become a Member link at the top of our website - Then click on Reactivate An Expired Membership; or - Feel free to contact our office.
If you're reactivating a paid membership, please be sure to have your credit/debit card information handy.
How do I update my monthly pledge?

###I’ve been a monthly donor to a project you sponsor. How do I log in to update my information?
Unfortunately, logging into an account on our website is only for Fractured Atlas members. If your monthly pledge has ended due to a billing issue, please go to the project’s donation page on our website to start a new gift. You can always call us at 888.692.7878 to edit your billing details over the phone or you can send an [email](mailto:support@fracturedatlas.org) to contact us about your recurring donation.
Why has my project name not been updated yet?

###I already sent in the request/documents to Fiscal Sponsorship to change the name on our membership. Why hasn't it been updated yet?!
Updating the legal entity on file for your fiscally sponsored project does not change the name listed on a membership account. If you would like to change the name of a member or company name on file with us for an account, please have the original member on the account send the request by email to support@fracturedatlas.org.
How do I cancel my membership?

Why would you ever want to leave?! Just kidding! We understand that, because of certain circumstances, you might need to cancel. The best way is to go to this [page](/site/members/prefs/?section=termination) and log in when prompted. You can also email or call our office. If you're choosing to leave because you can no longer afford our membership dues, we hope you'll consider switching to a free Community Membership instead of canceling your membership entirely. This is a great way to stay connected to the Fractured Atlas community without having to pay for it. To switch your membership level, simply contact our office.
I still have questions...
If you have any questions for us, feel free to send us an email to support@fracturedatlas.org. We will try our very best to get back to you in one business day.
Will Fractured Atlas alert me when my membership renewing?
Members do not receive email alerts before their card is charged, but do receive an email receipt every time their card is charged.
How do I edit my profile on the Meet Our Sponsored Projects page?

Each project must supply an online profile with their fiscal sponsorship application. Once a project is approved, this online profile can be edited at any time by logging into our website and choosing the [Edit Online Profile link](/site/fiscal/edit_profile_form).
Why has no one called me back?

We’re sorry that we missed you on the phone! Fractured Atlas’s office staff does not operate as a call center. If our team is either on the phone, occupied, or away from their desk, you will eventually be directed to a voicemail line. Please leave a message with your name, number, and inquiry so that we have a record that you called and would like a call back from us! You can also email us at support@fracturedatlas.org.
Who owns the art work I create while fiscally sponsored?

Fractured Atlas has designed our program so that you retain full ownership and control over the work you create while you're sponsored. [Please see the fiscal sponsorship agreement for full details.](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/download_contract)
Will you raise money for me?

Fractured Atlas relies on our fiscally sponsored projects to do the legwork of raising funds to create their art. We offer [educational resources](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/prodev/fractured_u) to help you become a better fundraiser. You're also welcome to ask our staff for feedback on your fundraising activities. Fiscal sponsorship is about providing you with tools to open doors to funding opportunities, but you will still need to put in the effort to find funders. If you're new to fundraising, [check out our webinars and events](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/about/events) for professional development opportunities.
Will you provide me with a list of donors?

Fractured Atlas cannot provide you with a list of donors because, believe it or not, the individuals who are most likely to contribute to support your work are already within your orbit. You should start by asking your nearest and dearest - friends, family members, co-workers - to consider making a donation. Then, encourage your early donors to share your project with their own network of friends, family, etc. to expand your potential pool of donors. You should also take a look at the community who your work is intended to benefit and identify potential prospects. Then, share that list with your inner circle to see if anyone can facilitate introductions so you can share your work with these members of your community.
For more fundraising tips, check out [Fractured U.](/site/prodev/fractured_u) and our [upcoming events ](/site/about/events).
Will you provide me with a list of grant funders?

For institutional funders, we strongly recommend that you conduct your own research to identify a list of prospective corporate sponsors and foundations to target. If you're not sure where the begin the [Foundation Directory Online](http://foundationcenter.org/findfunders/fundingsources/fdo.html) at the Foundation Center is a great resource. We also recommend searching on [NYFA Source](http://source.nyfa.org/content/search/search.aspx?SA=1).
We can offer you some assistance in creating a list of ten potential funders. Fractured Atlas staff will ask you a series of questions before conducting the research on your behalf. This service costs $100. Please contact [support@fracturedatlas.org](support@fracturedatlas.org) for more info. We recommend that you only have us research grants for you when you've reached the [eligibility requirement](/site/knowledgebase/grant-eligibility-requirement).
Related articles:
- [Applying for Grants: How does it work?](/site/knowledgebase/applying-for-grants-how-does-it-work)
Do you have a lawyer on staff that I can speak to?

While Fractured Atlas retains the use of legal advisors for our own business needs, we do not have someone on staff who is qualified to provide you with legal advice. Running a business often requires the [services of a good lawyer](/site/fiscal/page/legal_resources), so we recommend that you find one, especially when it comes to forming an LLC, incorporating, or becoming your own 501(c)(3).
Should I form an LLC or incorporate?

At a certain point in the lifespan of your business, it might become advisable for you to create a separate legal entity, like an LLC or corporation, to help protect your own interests. We can fiscally sponsored any type of business entity, provided that the specific programs or activities that we are sponsoring remain nonprofit in nature. For specifics about creating a separate business entity, we strongly recommend that you consult with [an attorney](/site/fiscal/page/legal_resources) who is qualified to help.
What is the difference between a non-profit and a for-profit project?

Fractured Atlas can only sponsor arts enterprises that are non-profit in nature.
A non-profit project is one that has a major public benefit; the work is intended for a larger audience and not for the private benefit of a few select people. A non-profit project also does not solicit the support of commercial equity agreements or private investors. If someone is contributing financially and expecting to receive a share in your profits, that person is an investor and your project is for-profit in nature.
You're welcome to make a profit on your project - and we hope you do - but any profits made would need to be spent on supporting the work itself, which could include paying yourself and your collaborators for their time and talents.
If your artistic project has a major public benefit and does not involve outside investors, then you should be a good fit for our fiscal sponsorship program.
What criteria will you look for in the nominees?

Recipients of the Arts Entrepreneurship Award will have:
- list text hereinnovated new business practices or paradigms - list text heredeveloped novel solutions to old problems
Check out our [About page](http://awards.fracturedatlas.org/about) for criteria and then [meet the past recipients](http://awards.fracturedatlas.org/2015) to learn more.
Who can submit a nomination?
Anyone can submit nominations for the Art Entrepreneurship Awards. You can nominate more than one person or company for an award. You are welcome to nominate yourself for an award.
Can I save my nomination form and complete it at a later date?
No, you can't save the nomination form and complete it at a later date.
When will the 2016 award recipients be announced?

The nomination process for the 2016 awards will open in the fall of 2015. Nominations can be made [on our website](http://awards.fracturedatlas.org/) once the process opens in the fall. Award recipients will be announced in early 2016.
FAQ for Renters

SpaceFinder is a matchmaking tool for renters looking for creative space, and spaces looking to promote their rentals. Powered by nonprofit Fractured Atlas, SpaceFinder is free to list or search for space.
### Frequently Asked Questions
**Who do I contact about renting a space?**
Fractured Atlas does not own and manage rental spaces, we provide regional online marketplaces for *other* spaces to be discovered and rented. So... it is best to contact a venue directly. Each space listing specifies a venues’ preferred method of contact so you know how to get the most speedy response.
**Is there a fee to book a space through SpaceFinder?**
Nope! There is no fee to book online.
**How does the information about rentals stay up to date?**
Fractured Atlas approves all listings before they get published. We follow up with a venue when a website link is dead, or a renter message bounces. Every six months venues are sent an email reminder to review their listing and update as needed. Calendars that show a space’s availability are automatically refreshed every day. If you see a listing that is inaccurate, please let us know and we will reach out to the venue.
**Can you help me find affordable space?**
We know it’s hard to find affordable space, that’s why we built SpaceFinder! In addition to filtering spaces by rental rates within your budget, understanding your options to qualify for non-profit or subsidized rates is a good place to start.
For details, check out: [Tips for Finding Affordable Space](/site/knowledgebase/tips-for-finding-affordable-space)
**How do I share a shortlist of spaces?**
Once you’ve run your search, look above the map of search results and select the option “Save this search”. Your search will be saved to your dashboard. You can right click to copy the link and share it with your collaborators, great time saver.
**How do I find a specific type of space or amenity if there isn’t a search filter for what I need?**
Keyword search is a catchall tool for discovering new spaces based on super specific needs. Keyword search is helpful for when looking for a specific type of space like “church,” “outdoor,” or “gallery,” or when looking for a specific type of amenity like “3D-printer,”, “piano,” or “bar”. You can even get creative and search for keywords that connect you to spaces with a certain vibe, like “artist-friendly” or “corporate”.
**I see there are lots of options to filter space, how can I sort my search results?**
Search results can be sorted (ascending or descending) by name, size, seating capacity, and distance from a specific location. All of these options are found on the footer of the search results map.
**The venue I want requires ‘proof of liability insurance’, what is that and how do I get it?**
General liability insurance covers you for damage to other people and other people’s stuff. If you kick a hole in the wall, or kick an audience member through a wall (accidentally, of course), this insurance will cover the cost. Many venues require general liability insurance to ensure renter claims won’t get charged to their own venue insurance policy. You’ll need to provide a Certificate of Insurance, also known as COI, listing the venue specifically as ‘additional insured.’
For details, check out: [When a Venue Requires Liability Insurance](/site/knowledgebase/when-a-venue-requires-liability-insurance)
**How Do I bring SpaceFinder to my city or region?**
Fractured Atlas has expanded SpaceFinder from it's origins in New York City to serve over a dozen cultural hubs across North America. We continue to partner with local leader organizations to expand SpaceFinder into new regions and communities. To see if a SpaceFinder is planned for your community, vote to show your support for a planned or requested expansion or to make the case for the need in your community, please visit the [Feature Request Forum for SpaceFinder](/site/knowledgebase/feature_request_list?topic=SpaceFinder).
Adding Images to Knowledge Base Articles

Adding an image to an article is a four step process. 1. **Prepare your image.** Use an external tool to format and size your image. It should be: - **JPG, GIF, PNG, and SVG** are accepted file types. (At this time, PDF and other file types do not work.) - **600px wide or less, ideally.** The max width is actually 940px but that looks terrible on a small screen. - **Under 500KB** - **Annotate with red arrows.** This is usually the most visually clear option and will keep the look consistent across articles. Avoid annotating images with lots text because text in images is not picked up by search tools. - **Make white space minimal and even.** The KB styling will automatically add a border to all images. This looks best when there is even white space around you images. - **Give context, but not the whole page.** Don’t crop screenshots too tightly. Users appreciate the context a wider shot gives them. However, showing the whole screen is rarely necessary and makes an article look dauntingly long. - **Exclude browser crud.** Unless showing the address bar is critical to your point, crop it out of your screenshots along with browser tabs, scroll bars, and the Fractured Atlas footer. 2. **Upload image.** 1. Go to the [asset upload page](/admin/Knowledgebase/asset_form). 2. Choose the file you want to upload and click "Add." 3. Check that your file appeared in the "Recently Added" section. 3. **Embed image.** 1. Navigate to your article. 2. On right, under "Recently Created Assets," click on the thumbnail of the image you want. (If you can't tell from the thumbnail which image This will select the image URL. 3. Copy the image URL. 4. In the content toolbar, click the image button. 5. In the modal, paste the link to the image. 6. This will paste some code into the body of the article. Go into that code and edit the image alt text and image title. 7. Check the image in the preview mode. 4. **Add required text.** When you insert a link to an image, the default code will say something like this "[enter image description here](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=9 "enter image title here")." You need to modify two parts of this code: - **Image alt text** describes an image so people who have disabled images in their browsers or are visually impaired and use a screen reader will know what the images depicts. Replace the placeholder text "enter image description here" with a description or delete it. - **Image title** is the text that appears when a user mouses-over an image. Replace the placeholder text "enter image title here" with a relevant, short, catchy, and concise title. 5. **Check it!** Duh. Flip to preview mode and check that your image looks right in the article. ### Image Tips Dealing with images can be the most time-consuming part of writing an article. These tips and work-flow suggestions may help speed that up. - **Include Numbers in File Name.** If you are adding several images to an article, it will be easier to find the image you want in the Recently Created Assets if you save the file with a names like "1SellingTickets," "2SellingTickets," "3SellingTickets." That way, when you mouse over the image thumbnail in Recently Created Assets, you will see the file name and know which image link to copy and insert. - **Upload All Images, Then Write.** If you know where your article is going, it may be helpful to prep and upload all your images first, and then start writing the article and formatting the text. - **Borders** will automatically be added to all images in articles. This default styling puts a solid gray line 1 pixel wide on all sides of the image. If your image a lot of white space on one side, the border will draw attention to that lopsidedness so try to keep the images evenly weighted. - **Resizing** images within an article is possible with a little HTML. - To resize with specific pixel dimensions, use code like this: `` - To resize by proportion, use code like this: `` - Maintaining correct proportions can be a little tricky with this technique though, so if you're not comfortable with it, just resize in an image editor before uploading to the assets library. - **Adding images within lists** can mess up your list order. Add a space after the image to preserve the numbering. Indent your images so they stay in-line with the outline levels. - **Tables** can be built in a third-party tool like [Markdown Table Generator](http://www.tablesgenerator.com/markdown_tables#) and copy-pasted into your articles. ### Videos Videos cannot be uploaded to the asset library, but you can link to hosted videos on sites like YouTube and Vimeo. 1. Go to the video hosting site and find the embed code. 2. Copy the code. 3. Navigate back to your KB article. 4. In the content toolbar, click the video button. 5. In the modal, paste the embed code. 6. Video will not play in preview mode, so you will need to save the article and view in agent browse mode to check that embedding worked correctly. ### Related Articles - [Intro to the Fractured Atlas Knowledge Base (CC)](/admin/Knowledgebase/view_article?id=191) - [Writing & Formatting Knowledge Base Articles (CC)](/admin/Knowledgebase/view_article?id=84)

To log out, navigate to [https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/members/logout](https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/members/logout) (There's no longer a log out button.)
**Note: Logging in as a member only gives you access to the pages in the fracturedatlas.org domain. To log in as a user in Artful.ly or SpaceFinder, you must do that through the app's super admin features.**

Examples of Community Directories on SpaceFinder

What is a community directory?

A community directory is a custom branded SpaceFinder landing page of spaces relevant to a specific community. For example a specific geographic area or specific creative discipline.

Where do you find the community directories?

Community directories are meant to be linked to from another organization's website. The directories are hidden landing pages on the SpaceFinder site, meaning you cannot navigate to them from within search. **Click here to view a brief video showing navigation from Dance/NYC's website to their branded directory of dance spaces on SpaceFinder NYC.**

What does it cost?

Community directories are provided at no charge as they function to increase visibility of and participation in SpaceFinder.

How long does it take to create a community directory?

Fractured Atlas can build a community directory landing page within 2 business days (once the customized elements are received).

What types of organizations have asked for community directories?

- Arts Councils - Arts Service Organizations - Business Improvement Districts - Creative Districts - Film Festivals - Fringe Festivals - Municipal Agencies - Neighborhood Alliances - Schools - Venues

How do I get a community directory for my organization?

Contact spacefinder@fracturedatlas.org or 888-692-7878 X228
