### 3 Minutes of Fame: Visa Applicant Edition (Holly)
- Wanted to do Visa Letters because sometimes forget about this service. Most letters are for o-1b visas which are for artists of extraordinary ability. I wanted to show some weird examples of artists who have gotten visa letters through us.
- Eliska Podzimkova ,https://instagram.com/animateny- We'll look at her Instagram to see type of work she does. She is from the Czech Republic and her work focuses on New York. - Liana Yaroslavsky, http://lianayar.com/ - She is a furniture designer from Russia who designs coffee tables and side tables. We didn't think she would be able to get visa, but decided there was an artistic quality to the tables. - Bryn Court, http://www.moviesculptor.com/ - He is a Scenic sculpting consultant from the UK. He has designed sculptures for a lot of movies and wanted a visa to sculpt items for the Harry Potter theme park. - Robyn "Rihanna" Fenty, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ao8cGLIMtvg - Sent out Rihanna's video- we all know rihanna, but thought the video also thematically linked to immigration.
### Ask the ED: Adam Huttler (10 minutes)
Before we go to questions, I want to explain what I will be doing in the month of August. I have done this the last two years and will be doing it again this year--hermitage. The idea is to take a month to be totally disconnected from day to day work and to focus on a project with sustained attention. There is also practical value for everyone else to be reminded that I am totally unnecessary to running day to day of FA. This year's plan is to work with the team working on microphilanthropy software, to technically define requirements that need to be rebuilt. The benefit to choosing this for the hermitage is to work out all the details--things that would be missed if not intentional. I know the existing software pretty well so that should speed development and make better. Still working out communication with Mauricio and Dan. I'm looking forward to it.
**Questions?**
*Q (MLS)- What's the timing with labor day being so late?* A- I will be coming back first week of September
*Q- What if people need you?* A- It depends on what the need is. On certain things, people will need to just need to make a decision or wait until I am back. For tech issues, talk to Shawn and do what you normally would do if I am out. 2 people will have a bat phone- Tim and Shawn. You will have to go through them to get to me.
*Q (Christine)-* *Will they be building the functionality for the process implemented during the month?* A-The idea is to run a bunch of R Spec tests. Development methodology to use special set of code to define tests that can run in an automated way to confirm or not to see if works the way we want. It's a cool way to develop software. For those unfamiliar, make tests first, then write code to make the tests pass. It's a way for me to stay out of the way for people to code, but make something useful for developers.
*Q (Malcolm)-After Holly (Sidford) was here earlier this week, I am riled up by state of the art world. Within and outside of our current programs, if we understand race, gender, etc. to be barriers, what are we doing?* A-On a basic level, FA exists to try and disrupt the existing system. When starting FA, there was the focus on the size of organization. This is still a meaningful way to look at things. Our mission = eliminate practical barriers, and all that you have mentioned do work as barriers. I do think they are relevant. Having FA as an anti-racist org is a way to see how race plays into these barriers. Where it gets complicated is how do we change our services to focus on those specific things instead of casting a wide net. Jason and Ian spend a lot of time thinking about specific communities that we are not reaching and what we need to do to reach them. There is not a magic bullet on this, it's a slog. One example that pops into my mind that is timely is that Lisa is working with is disability in dance. Pleased that we are able to engage that work.
*Lisa-* Found interesting in projects that wanted to apply for fiscal sponsorship but wanted to ask first, but was unsure. They didn't know if they were invited. If they had seen other projects like themselves they might not hesitate.
*Adam- *I like the phrase "didn't feel invited." My bias is that just having it open is enough, but that is not enough. We do need to make the special effort and show up in those communities.
*Jason-* I have been able to travel to specific gatherings around the country and something that struck me being in those spaces is that almost nobody knows FA. At other arts events, people know who FA is--there's an aura. This also cements in my mind how much we need to get in front of people. It's great that we have small initiatives, but need to make more part of everyday organization.

**c. Dianne Debicella (Dianne out- Theresa)** We're moving toward beta testing for Power2Give site, and making training webinars for curators (site hosts). Also, FS team is redoing webinars to get fresh look and creating new grant and donation resources to give best practices.
**d. Marie-Louise Stegall-** We're closing in at the end of the FY so we have a more solid view of how we will end up. We're about 90% there of all given and pledges which is a 35% increase from last year. We're looking forward to FY16 which already has quite a bit of pledges and given. Thanks all for helping out with various applications. -Also working on event.
**e. Ian David Moss -**Last month we did our first survey of staff. I will be sending out a written recap of results. Generally there were strong results overall. I was impressed with how positive it was. The most agreed statement was "Overall I'm happy to be working at FA" with 93% agreeing with statement. The least agreed was "do you believe that you are fairly compensated," although more agreed than disagreed. From the attraction form, other people at FA and culture are a big factor in wanting people to work here, especially in interview and job description. Overall, things are pretty good. There will be more details to share in the written recap.
This is part of a larger process to make a data dashboard as a set of numbers relating to standard operating, need more data gathering. -Also working on theories of change for different programs. Also looking ahead, working on something brought up at the last offsite--sense of return on investment on travel.
**Q (Lisa)- **Is the data dashboard one of the ways we can answer diversification part of the everyday A(Ian)- It could be helpful, but is not the answer with a capital A. We will have numbers that speak to that, it will be something to look at on an regular basis, and also will be a resource for what can we do to yield results.
**f. Selena Juneau-Vogel** Thanks for being nice, with the rough month we had. Things are smoothly running now. This summer we will do a serious brand book clean up of KB articles. Next week we will release some new features including: record staff members who took order, users can record nick names, can opt in to get an email any time a donation is made (501(c)3), can sell tickets again and count as donation if person cannot attend. Right now these are just for 501(c)3s but will eventually be for FS projects as well. I will be working with Theresa on the nitty-gritty of artful.ly to help integration with FS projects. The 4 program directors have been meeting on regular basis to streamline customer service experience, looking at incremental things that would help program administration. Looking at big issues that need larger focus. Example- it may make sense to track customer service on an organizational level instead of on a program level. We want to track correspondence with organizations and not just the people (would be helpful for organizations with staff turnover).
**Q (Nathan)-** Does big picture include staff behavior (are we rude)? A(Selena)- Hasn't come up yet, but looking at how we continue thematic goal to make a better customer experience. Lisa- sounds like Nathan is asking about how to improve not on a feature base- There will be training and best practices to focus on looking at people from this org level.
**g. Lisa Niedermeyer** 2 buckets of time, primarily- disability in dance and increasing space inventory Disability- outreach and looking at features Inventory- looking at Toronto and Birmingham, which are smaller pots but are brand new and have developing arts.

*b. Arts & Technology Fellowship Report* There's a house bill dealing with the appropriation of money to cultural agencies. This has brought lots of art organizations and lobbyists to the hill, and people are really focusing on that. There are a few things on the chopping block, like place making grants. There's also momentum dealing with education. The arts interest are amendments on the arts side of things--art as core academic subject, teacher training, etc. Because of all this, I will be pausing outreach on the hill until August. The Frozen Parody will debut in the spring for Fair Use week.
### Operations Updates (15 Minutes)
**a. How We Work (Tim)**
*Renovation:* You have probably seen people coming through office looking around and measuring. Nicola and I have been working with people on the aesthetics of the space. Just switching out furniture would not look so great, so we're looking into options to change the look of the space with carpet and paint. The people we are working with will give us a full plan to see how to turn it into reality. Nicola is working on this because everyone might have to work off-site for a week to do install. This could be at some point in late August and early September. We will let everyone know when we know the exact dates.
*Laptops:*Thanks for taking the survey, everyone. Shawn has been working on the Mac option for everyone. There will still be some people on PCs for various reasons, but most everyone will be on Macs by the end of July. We will start switching over in waves, so not everyone will get laptops at the same time. They will be retina Mac book pros because most people want closed laptops with dual monitors. Nicola has been doing a monitor survey. Lots of things are being cued up, and we will let you know when we have more information.
*401k:* Jillian has been spearing the 401k switch. It's pretty complicated, but she has been doing great work on it. The goal is to have conversations in August, both a talk with a financial advisor about how it will work and also personal sit downs. There are no dates yet, but Jillian wants it wrapped up by end of the FY. It's not through Paychex. On January 1 we're looking to change payroll services to Zen. At that point everything will be streamlined again.
*2 positions are live for staffing. *For the Director of Programs, interviews will start next week. There is no deadline, but we would like to get some interviews done before Adam's hermitage. The Program associate position is up, so spread the word. The numbers are ramping up. Let Nicola know if you have recommended anyone and she will put at top of the pile.
*We will be getting rid of Wiki at the end of August* and will be putting everything over to the internal Knowledge Base. Selena is working on categories. Also, are there ideas for names? Selena- I'm likeing IKB, as a reference to International Klein Blue. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Klein_Blue
**b. Finance Report (Tim)** If you look at the report printed in color, it is not pretty. It's actually pretty concerning. We are tracking some of the numbers because we have been slightly off pace. Some will not end where we thought they would. We are looking at what we can do for the future. This is the first year where we will not hit many of the goals. Adam- I stand by and think that membership dues will be right on. Tim- A couple of things that are serious- Fiscal Sponsorship numbers because it's our biggest revenue engine. That's a huge fall off from where we were hoping to be. Adam and I are looking at this. This year effects next budget. I will pass on any things if all need to know or if anything is actionable.
**c. End-of-FY Finances (Nicola)**
*Prepaid expenses-* Just a reminder that as we close this FY in August, we need to be aware of any prepaid expenses because we account for them differently. Any time you purchase something for next FY, please make note of this in the email for reimbursement or CC notes. An example is if you buy a flight in August, but the flight is not until September. Since the flight happens in September, we need to account for it as a prepaid expense. Feel free to email me if you have any questions.
*Professional Development Stipends and member ticket allowance-* We are also coming to the close of this FY's professional development and ticket stipend. I'll be sending updated totals in the next week so that you know where you are at. Remember that it does not roll over, but also note that similarly to prepaid expenses, if the class or show is in September, it count's for next FY stipend, even if you purchase it in August.
**d. Staff Meeting Chairs (Nicola)** We need volunteers to be meeting chairs! Email me if you have any interest and I'll set up chairs starting in September.
**e. Summer Party (Nicola) -**You all should have gotten the super cool invite that Malcolm put together. We have some exciting stuff planned for you all. If you have not yet RSVPd, please do that. If you want to contribute any food dish, email Jillian. Also, if you have any pictures of you at camp, send them my way. If you didn't go to a formal summer camp, other things that are acceptable include: you playing sports, going camping with family or friends, making crafts, going fishing, doing whatever you did summers off.

### 2012 March Staff Meeting Minutes
3.1.12
**ACTION ITEMS** - Send Adam N Cultureflash topics: technology, fundraising/devo/marketing, “the big idea” or any relevant blog posts you want to be - syndicated. Send at any time, Adam will keep them on file. - Philly party: Feel free to send to other people in the area and spread the word - You can now sign up for AFCU, and you can send Steve questions - Dianne will reach out to contact at Chicago Art Expo to check on Jean Anne’s workshop status. - PS – we don’t cut checks to vendors in Fiscal Sponsorship.
**NOTES**
**Review of last month’s action items - ** NYCPASPACES on the wiki - Have a look at the blog post regarding event ticketing - Get in touch with Natale if you have Cultureflash stuff
**Ask the ED -** *Future of Music Coalition:*
- Have been having an ongoing conversation for a while o Starting to look like something might solidify and take shape o In the wake of SOPA PIPA, started looking at that as a prototype of type of work we might do – looking at harmonize cultural policy and technology policy, as they’re often pitted against each other. Adam thinks it’s not accurate or helpful, and there’s a good opportunity and ideological niche to go into. Also a possibility of getting funding from tech interests who are in a position to benefit from that narrative being dismantled a bit. o Have been talking with Google, also have a meeting with Union Square Ventures, NYC based venture capital firm. Also Kickstarter and others. o If we can raise money we’re looking at doing a strategic plan over 6-9 months, if we raise less money, thinking about a jointly managed policy institute that would be in DC, with: Research (we would manage), Policy and Analysis (FMC would manage), Community Organizing (both of us would manage) o Lisa asks who they are? - They’re a DC based “think tank” which Adam thinks isn’t totally inaccurate - Not as old as we are. Do a lot of work looking at the Future of Music. One of first people to talk about net neutrality, instrumental in getting low power radio legislation passed, released an interesting study on artist revenue streams o Gary asks if they’re Nonprofit? • Yes they are. - How does Union Square Ventures figure into this? - Not totally sure, but it was a good meeting. Their model is venture capital. They’re starting an entity of their own that will be looking at these ventures from a tech-centric viewpoint. Will probably be a nonprofit, but probably they’ll be looking for a way to do some kind of for profit model. They’d probably make some kind of contribution, but more likely they’d be taking an ongoing role with helping to connect the tech institute to people in the tech community. For example, they have a lot of music tech startups, maybe they would pay some kind of subscription fee and they would get access to the raw data.
*Strategic Priorities Memo –*
- any thoughts on that? Anyone read it? - Emily says it’s helpful. Helpful to see the language that people use to talk about their corners of Fractured Atlas. Tone, language, ways of approaching. - Helpful to see how people approach these different ideas. - Ian felt inspired to access Big Thinking after reading other people’s responses. - Any epiphanies or areas of connection that people recognized? o Helps have a more holistic sense of everything - Ian was a bit confused by different formats people used to respond - maybe helpful to set up the responses as bullet points, then organize by bullet point? Might help people who aren’t required to respond to respond to individual points.
*Ask the ED -* Nada!
**Program activities: **
*Philly member party* is happening on Tues 3/27 at the Trestle Inn, a newer artist friendly establishment that Kara and Lois from DanceUSA recommended. - We have a private room, from 5:30p-8:30p - Who intends on going? - Lisa’s going to go, and bring the Philly Space Finder person with him. - Mailchimp is sending to about 520 people, and push it via social media. - Feel free to send to other people in the area - Hoping for 30-50 people - Partnering with DanceUSA Philly and other local arts orgs
*Health Insurace focus groups:*
- had a focus group in DC last week, was raining, had invited 12 people but 6 people showed up. Split between 25 and younger and 50 and older, and most were insured, which was not the intention. - Most people want free health insurance, or a $50-100 plan that covers absolutely everything. - Found out that they find information about health insurance via Twitter (?!) sense is it’s them paying attention to what’s happening via twitter.? - In that group, people are looking very much at segments of their lives and friends and families to get info on health insurance. - Comments like “there should be some kind of nonprofit that helps people get information about health insurance!” sooo… need some education there. - Chicago just happened, NYC next week, re-doing DC because it went so badly. - Then just have to decide what to do with it if we’re going to do anything with it. - How can we help people now and not scare them in 2014? - Some people thought they would go to jail in 2014 if they weren’t insured!
*Credit Unions! *
- you can all sign up for the Actors Federal Credit Union - meeting today will be at 4pm - would like to get some info on timing of member surveys - will be doing some kind of focus groups or since they’re unpaid, “pocus troops” - still trying to locate mentors or people who have experience - Why did we join AFCU again? - Were interested in it for members, but couldn’t because our members don’t really have a vote. Have been talking to them about our members for about a year, but they were worried about us starting our own credit union… which we’re doing! - Getting a loan from a credit union is much easier, also their credit card rate is great
**Travel** - Dianne was in CA - SF for 2 days, spoke at California College of Arts and then LA for College Art Association - Went to indiegogo office, met some staff. Lot of cute dogs in the office. - Also met with SF film society and Bay Area video association - In LA had the crowdfunding panel at CAA – first time we went to this conference, not sure if it’s the best fit. About 5-6K people, but individual artists are there trying to get academic positions. Very academic. Most people going didn’t attend the professional development sessions. Put all PD sessions at the same time. - People do seem to go to the tables, but not a lot of tech savvy attendees. - Had Kickstarter/Fractured Atlas party at a gallery with dungeons and dragons artwork. Everyone thought it was our artwork. - Did people come to the party because of Kickstarter or FA? It was a mix. Wondering why we were with each other. - Kickstarter no longer wants to be identified as “crowdfunding,” they want to be known as “Kickstarter.” - Trying to move away from being known as a crowdfunding platform. - KS put out a press release that they’re on pace to give more money than the NEA, and that made Adam H irritated - Adam H going to CA - Ian going to CA to speak at Arts Enterprise Summit - Org that tries to connect business school grads with artists - Doing a workshop on the “well informed arts professional” - SXSW coming up, Dianne first, also going to Houston and Austin to do a grants panel and a party with Indiegogo on Monday night, Adam second doing music. Adam’s up against the guy who wrote Rainbow connection. Also trying to do an Artfully and maybe a Spaces workshop in Austin, then going to Houston and going to Spacetaker, meeting with Houston endowment and an org that might be interested in Athena. - Jean Anne going on first road trip to Chicago! Waiting on hearing back on her workshop – “Insurance for Risk Takers.” Dianne is also going, doing a session on Fiscal Sponsorship and Crowdfunding. - Juliana going to Atlanta for Atlanta Film Festival. Strange radio silence since she booked her film, Emily hasn’t heard anything at all about her session either. - Gamification workshop tonight? - Workshop being hosted by Engine Yeard on “gamification” – making things more game like and therefore more attractive
**Program-related items?** - we no longer mail checks to vendors. We cut checks to vendors, we don’t mail checks to vendors. - - Are we making an announcement? Putting it on Twitter and making another announcement soon. - Push EFT!
**2 open positions:** - Tech and grantwriting. Trying to get grantwriting in place before tech.
**Finance reports:** - today starts Q3, yesterday ended Q2 - Liability Insurance – were using a company that backed out, had to find a new company. There is some seasonality, seeing a big increase in volume right now. Still at an early stage in knowing how to budget properly for LI. Possibility that income projections were a little aggressive. - There is an impulse to be conservative when budgeting because it feels good to surpass goals, but Adam would encourage us to be accurate. Would rather see you miss by 5% on an ambitious goal that exceed by 50% on a stupid goal. - Adam and Tim made first pass on FY13, will be bringing it to directors in the coming weeks.

Citywide or Brooklyn Lots of travel this month!
Recap some trips that may or may not have been interesting…
APASO, mostly theater and performing arts alliances throughout the country We presented on technology and Adam did a panel on individual artists Any broad strokes takeaways? Lot of them are freaked out about money and large institutions closing. Their member organizations and the service orgs. Meeting a bunch of potential artful.ly resellers Heard a lot about project audience – seems like a lot of people have bought into it, doesn’t seem to have a lot of management focus. Still haven’t really shown what project audience will do
Lisa went to DC for a community design session Clear articulation of what visual artists need out of their space Film really fits in performing arts model Excited about organized searchable database of technology Federal buildings are a particular issue, certain spaces have security issues and also historic buildings have special circumstances.
Arts Advocacy Day, Emily Huge majority of downstate New York representatives Different experiences with different congresspeople – not too hard to convince NY congresspeople to support the arts Not a lot of cross pollenation in terms of geographic diversity American for the Arts does a great job of preparing materials. Lot of college students there, lot of midcareer professionals working in a NFP arts org 3 main talking points, restore NEA to 2 years ago money for arts education congressional arts caucus smaller issues – more interesting to us? White space, tax incentives, etc. maybe could throw a party after arts advocacy day? Could make a bigger deal out of the fact that we’re there.
Tim went to Vancouver Meetings on how to use data and revolutionize philanthropy through data People involved in social enterprise and entrepreneurship Interesting group of people. Took away – different way of looking at what we’re doing. Positions us differently by tapping into these networks. Fruitful to go to some of these gatherings. Tim was the only person from the cultural sector.
Baltimore, Pittsburgh – Selena Wide topic on enhanced patron records in Baltimore Event co-hosted by Robert W. Deutsch foundation, trying to establish selves as an arts funder Gemini UI guy is coming
Then Selena and Adam Natale are going to Pittsburgh. Hosted by Greater Pittsburgh Arts Council South Dakota, Tim and Gary going to South Dakota for Davos institute Talking about managing and using your data One of 5 groups presenting.
Austin – Adam going to Austin National Arts Strategies chief executive program UT Austin, the “New Nature of Money.”
Adam Natale headed to New Orleans Sweet Home New Orleans – lot of independent musicians in NOLA Artfully workshop, individual artists workshop, culture guy at the mayor’s office
Denver – Create Denver expo, Dianne is going
Last Thursday and Friday of the month, National Network of Fiscal Sponsors meeting is taking place. Juliana and Adam are taking part in the meeting.
June 13, having a Fiscal Sponsorship information session in NYC at Wicks Lounge. Stop doing webinars in the summer. Wicks space is cool. Adam did a session there last night. Open to having other events there, it’s free. Spaces or Artful.ly could consider the space.
Health Insurance positioning, Emily
the point is not, “Fractured Atlas doesn’t do health insurance.”
Please send anyone with questions to Emily
In general,
Everything is still available when we were facilitating direct enrollment on ehealthinsurance. Don’t have to be a member. Never facilitated enrollment in group plans, even though people think we did. Still very much active and engaged in that space, just shifting our priorities to make sure we are best serving the membership. Not an ehealthinsurance program. Not necessary to mention ehealthinsurance, we have a partnership with them. User friendly self service tool on our website, staff is available to help with questions.
Tim has things to mention:
Next Wednesday, first visiting professional. Arbitron, General Foods. Part of 2 technology startups. Serves on the board of Welch’s. Just Q&A. Wondering if there are any things to ask him
Really big deal that Tim is getting these people to do this We should be thoughtful about how to make the most out of this Adam has some questions about marketing and branding
Summer Fridays:
Full time staff member, work a full Friday between memorial and labor day, can accrue a half vacation day.
Have to let Tim know if you work a full day.
Otherwise, office closes at 2.
Added into the pool that is eligible to be swept forward, so you get a third of however many days you have at the end of summer Friday time.

### 2012 June Staff Meeting Minutes
ACTION ITEMS
Emily is leading brainstorm on 25k member party, she'll send an e-mail.
Ongoing FB/Twitter tags- one featured artist tagged per day- speak to Nathan
Search one missing congressional district that does not represent any of our members
Check out PKPR's website, they are our new publicity consutant firm.
We should be talking more as Organization wide definition of CDS in terms of our Fractured Atlas brand.
Emerging Leader In The Arts Award- Adam Natale!
Think about questions for our upcoming visiting professional series. Tim will send around more about Carol McFate's work history so that we can form questions as well as next month's VP.
Summer Party to be planned.
FMC UPDATE Adam H gave an overview of upcoming FMC event. (Adam and Ian attending) The event will be more of a strategy/brainstorm conversation.
Next Step: A feasibility study to see if the concept an institute is viable. RFP has been sent out.
Ask the ED: 25K member party? noted: actual stats are different on the website because they are weighted, there is also an attrition rate based on the members we lose simultaneously.
Should this be internal or external? Not sure. There will be more discussion. Some thoughts: If its public, we could involve our OAN partners via satlite? Offer free membership for everyone that is 25? Or just get drunk together?
Cultural Policy Issue Ideas to present to Council Members.. no ideas at the moment, but Adam did toss out an idea of some kind of gov't support for artists or arts ors to buy real estate in neighborhoods where they have lived or worked for a long time. But of course its expansive and not scalable at the moment. Naturally Occurring Cultural Districts: term borrowed from urban planning. A model alternative to gentrification. But people behind this movement are not very politically pragmatic.
PROGRAM UPDATES 1. Twitter/FB tags- Featured Artists of the Day Nathan is tweeting on one featured FS project per day. Lots of FB likes but no click He is making sure it is diverse by geographically and discipline
Trying to make it about people that have events coming up, but we should also connect this somehow to artists that are using Artful.ly
We may want to give artists a heads up so that they can gear up their social media networks to capitalize on these tags.
Ultimately the hope is to expand attention to artists using other programs. Maybe it would be better to feature an artist for a whole week. A lot easier than something new each day. This also gives the members more time to rally behind the idea that they are featured.
New Marketing Firm Hired 2.PKPR. They have a lot of great clients that have a crossroads of technology and culture. google them, and check out their website.
Right now they are gathering info about all of our programs, and whats on deck. Notably Emily spoke with them today about our work on the affordable healthcare act. But they will be speaking with all program directors, and working with Tim on general member stats and strategy.
They have great connections to press in tech, entrepreneurial, and culture realms.
TRAVEL
South Dakota (Tim and Gary) Convening of arts/fundraising/marketing sector experts, focusing on technology. Poverty in SD is notable. A lot of start up arts development plans, such as repurposing spaces for arts related use.
Baltimore/Detroit/Pittsburg (Selena) Community Design Sessions CRM Features Learned that people need surgical list/reporting functionality. Something that we don't have but is a high priority
E-mail and export functionality
Mixed feedback about social media. Twitter trumps Facebook? People want to use social media integrated with CRM strategically but don't know how, there may be an opportunity here for us.
How can we capitalize on CDS to communicate that we are the good guy in terms of developing arts technology. And make it part of the FA Brand.
Business Plan Consultants- hired to work on plan for Artful.ly. Draft of plan has been submitted and we are working with them on a revision. This will be helpful to us internally, and will help creditbitliy with funders- An accessible lens for understanding Artful.ly.
ON THAT NOTE Big Important Idea: Focus for the next yr or so- focus on Artful.ly as opposed to Athena, and our existing constituency as opposed to new business. This is our market. Analysis of member survey and cross ection of how many events are ticketed per yr by members- money we could make is compelling. This will buy us time to make the functionality that will attract commercial ors.
Ian- Attended mtg- Animating Democracy Work in the Arts that have social change as some part of their goals. not too productive, but helped him wrap thinking around how to adapt various logic models See blog posts about Ian's work with Arts Wave.
Natale- Americas for The Arts- getting award!
Chorus America conference (Ian Emily) Bringing new Opera Pocket Guides Ian moderating talk
Games For Change Conference (Dianne)
Dance USA (Emily/Tim)
National Assoc of Teachers of Singing NATS (Emily)
Gather Altanta (Lisa)
Grant Makers in the Arts- publishing an article about Ian.
Visiting Professional Series Carol McFate this month Jack Waters- next month On Deck: Adams Dad Tim locking down others.
What is a good criteria for a VP? interesting work outside the arts field.
Carol- was on board for David Parsons. Lots of interesting work in the financial world, a very rich history in business.
Audit is complete, ask Tim if you have questions
Finance Report.
Tim is considering rotating staff meeting chairs.
Summer Party? Hasn't been planned

this was a great success!
### Ask the ED
- What’s happening with the IRS audit? - So far so good, they have a minor tax change they want to make- only relevant when an organization is dissolving and needs to distribute assets. We have unofficial confirmation and are waiting for written confirmation - Conversations with Arts & Business Council of New York - Adam sent them a term sheet in December and they didn’t like it - America for the Arts wants more direct management with AFTA leadership - FA and Municipal Art Society were the two possibilities - NAS Conversation: National Arts Strategies in Alexandria, VA—the possibility of a merger (THIS IS CONFIDENTIAL) - Conversation began discussing a meaningful joint venture with Fractured U - Bringing in NAS industry to reinvent content—should this be one organization? - Two organizations that have non-overlapping, incredibly complementary strengths and resources—is there a way to strengthen by combining? - NAS CEO is not looking to be the CEO of this organization - They are a 501C3 with a 2 million dollar operating budget, mostly grant funded - They were created by the Ford Foundation - They have nine staff members. - We serve little guys, they serve big guys—many other complementary factors
### Program Activities
**Program Reports (2 minutes each)**
**Archipelago** - Initiative for Stable Arts in America - Hauser center for non-profit orgs at Kennedy school at Harvard - Unofficially participating for a while, but recently signed a contract with them - Three year, constantly expanding effort to combine data-driven, promote data-driven decision making in specific regions and at the national level - Doing so by scaling archipelago to be in each of those places, combined with on the ground network building in each of these communities - Goal: more rational collective decision making and allocation of resources among people who are distributing resources among the arts community - Hiring a new staff person (Program Specialist for Archipelago) - Redesigning the archipelago interface - We will present an initial concept to the stakeholders in Detroit
**Artful.ly**
- Intergration with mail chimp: you can sync your list in mailchimp and import it into artful.ly - Wordpress plugin: version of the widget, allows people to take donations on their site - Discount codes: on the horizon, Clinton has been working for a month, either x dollars off or two for one, can apply to both general admission or VIP price - Gary has made cool reporting feature for discount code stats - Redesign patron interface in February-March, will show lifetime sales, also include gravatar
**Fiscal Sponsorship**
- No longer issuing refund release checks as of this morning- projects can no longer request them - Changing fee structured as of March 1st: 7% on all donations received by check and credit card up to lifetime of 150,000. After that, only 6% up to 500,000. Up to 1,000,000: 5%, and after a million: 4%. - Can process $20,000 for a credit card transaction
**Insurance**
- Combining health insurance and liability insurance on the website - Only some of our policies are liability, so “My Liability” is now “My Insurance” - Health Insurance section is now called “Healthcare Resources” - Insurance glossary has been added - New applications in the process of being added—application for -Art Galleries (GC, Workers comp, propertry insurance, etc.) - Program being developed for residency programs—hopefully will be up before residency tour - Can no longer do automatic accident quotes - Soon incorporating good RX on to health resources page—provides data on prescriptions available locally, including stores and online vendors, also provides coupons
**Research**
- Cultural research community in practice—group of researchers, have been talking for a while about re-launching, originally created with Bay Area Cultural asset map - Ian has been talking to colleagues in these organizations to make it more of a shared venture
**Spaces**
- In the scaling phase (R&D) - Evolving from a venue directory to a marketplace - The way the renters contact the venue: email, phone call, or online booking - Default option to contact venue will be through our system - Part 2: increasing customer base. Currently 1000 venues in NY, need 4x this to make it profitable - Releasing a testing map for new accounts - Increase accounts by seeding and inviting
**Travel - Big Board Review (Any staff)**
- The Big board is open! - By next month, there will be a team for the Southern Tour. PKPR is helping with that.
**Other Items**
- Merging Customers in database (Nathan) - Adam says, “light a candle and pray when you do it” - Will never be full proof for customers with extensive histories - Should be done, but be careful and pay attention beforehand, and if there’s a particular aspect that seems thorny, take a look to make sure nothing blows up - Don’t merge a Community member with an Individual membership - Initiative for Sustainable Arts in America
### Operations
- Program associate will be hired for insurance - Artful.ly developer will also be hired- interviews will happen in January - Emily has decided to move on. She has been here for a long time in many different positions, and we are sad to see her go. She will stay on for a little while to help with the transition - A. Finance Report - B. Birthday Santa Drawing (Theresa) - Remember that it’s a $50 budget - It’s not a competition! - Don’t sacrifice budget for theme

### Agenda
**I. Adam Huttler (10 minutes)**
**A. Ask the ED**
- What did the board say about NAS? - they were supportive and enthusiastic, but not without concerns and big questions - Thought we were potentially complementary, but could also potentially clash - They want to be involved in this process, and Rodney and Holly will be in the next round of conversations
**B. USA Projects / Power2Give**
- We’re having conversations with USA projects (the crowd-funding division) - Wanted to collaborate around crowd-funding technology and building the next generation of it and integration - Adam has a three-way conversation about possibility of USA Projects and Power2Give collaborating on a new open-source crowd-funding platform, based on what they have each learned independently, but also with new features - We would serve as consultants and advisors - Power2give wants to spin off from the Arts and Science Council - We’ve talked about them coming into our organization as a tier 2 FS project - There is a lot of interest around this project, and Adam will keep us updated

### II. Program Activities (30 minutes)
**A. Program Reports (2 minutes each)**
**1. Archipelago & Research**
- final round of interviews this week for program specialist - gone through first iterations of redesign for the interface - combining with the sustainable arts initiative - Calgary Arts Authority (Canada)- new contract with them
**2. Arful.ly**
- Gary: we have a third round interview for new developer - Talking about integrating artful.ly with FA to minimize confusion for members
**3. Development**
- Typically, ratio to philanthropic dollars to earned revenue is 50/50, but FA is different (less than a third from contributions) - We want to expand the base of support to include other sources (corporate individuals) - Started with an appeal at the end of the year - we pulled from a list of 300 donors and sent out letters. 10 donors responded - we’ve had 75 donations from the end of the fiscal year to today - The goal is to develop a more regular habit of giving from donors - Marie-Louise wants to build a major gifts program: $5,000 would be considered a major gift. She is generating a list of prospects - how are we going to let people in and let them know what we do? - a cultivation plan based around FA projects, events we can bring donors to meet our projects and say, “this project was made possible b/c FA made it happen”
**4. Fiscal Sponsorship**
- still trying to balance enthusiasm for tier 2 with getting it launched off the ground - tier 2: a more comprehensive FS project that provides more backend support - Adam: we’re focused not on artists but on other infrastructure providers, to provide incubation for other service organizations. We have four good candidates now, three of which have budgets in excess of $500,000
**5. Insurance**
- The Field has left the OAN - we have been back and forth with them to ensure that members don’t contact the insurance companies directly
**6. Spaces**
- new function: invite venues - we will be delivering the Spaces API. First customer will be Karr in Chicago arts resources - updating ruby on rails - Lisa will be away in Cambodia!
**B. New tag for "Power User" in the CRM (Lisa)**
- In the member database - If they are using more than one service, if they are being exceptionally helpful - Write a note in the CRM for why you tagged someone
**C. Travel Report APAP**
- Lisa says: have an ipad at the table! - We got a lot of positive feedback, people thanking us for being there
**Sundance**
- Jean Ann’s talk went really well, spoke at Artists services day - A 90 min talk aout E&O insurance - Someone from vimeo wants to partner with us for E&O - Jean Ann saw two films, one with an awkward talk-back with Michael Cera! - Southern Tour is happening right now - College Art Association is next month - Three staff members will be San Francisco in March, so they will not be at the staff meeting
**Yale Philanthropy Conference (Jason)**
- building the space between corporate and non-profit entities - supporting social enterprises to maximize social impact - New wave of philanthropy will be social impact investments—how can we leverage this? - "Instead"- a micro philanthropy app, started as non-profit and went to for-profit to leverage capital - What are social impact investments? - Currently, in developing world, social enterprises are selling products (like medical products, water treatment), etc. taking a foundation’s investment portfolio and choosing to make a financial return on things that benefit the world
**Undoing Racism Workshop (Jason & Jean Ann)**
- held by the People’s Institute - It was great: 3 days long, but the time was very productive - walked away with a lens through which to view institutions - it was about ending racism, not about diversity, taking the want for diversity one step further, showing how racism is a construct in institutions - gave tools for an analysis of who we worked with, in terms of socio-economic status - is neutrality inherently racist because it supports the status quo? - perpetuating a status quo perpetuates a racist system - Ideas: the switch over to EFT: necessitates having a bank account. If you have a criminal record, it may be more difficult to get a bank account, and in communities of color, there might be a higher prevalence of criminal records—are we perpetuating racism? - Ian: a natural bias of capitalism, that the status quo is often the most efficient. Therefore, there is a concentration of resources towards people who fit the definition of “normal,” and it would cost more money to serve those considered out of the “normal” curve. - Did the workshop provide tools to prioritize? - A power analysis? Where does power flow in the organization? - Adam: How do you balance financial costs with ethical costs? Our mission is to support artists regardless of color, but also to support as many artists as possible - Jillian: Should we get in touch with Christine Bader to help us form this group?
### III. Operations (15 minutes)
- We are closed President’s day - Program specialist nearing end of search, developer nearing end of search, 200 apps for program associate - April 1st will be a possible start date for the program associate
**A. Finance Report**
- By February 1st, we should be at 42% - We are still off-pace for membership dues, but will address this at the monthly marketing task-force - Third Rail is breaking the finance report with their sales—recently over $30,000
**B. Competing Values framework—thanks to everyone for doing that.**

### 2013 September Staff Meeting Minutes
Chair: Tim Cynova
OkTECHberfest 2013 ‐‐ Full Staff Meeting
Tuesday, September 10, 2013 2:00‐3:00PM
### September Action Items
- Find Lisa a Spaces Marketing Fellow - Check out the website for Culture Works - Send travel itineraries to travel@fracturedatlas.org - Formalize system for notarized documents and signatures (for when Adam is away)

### Agenda
Welcome to OkTECHberfest 2013!
**I. Adam Huttler(15 minutes)**
**A. Fractured Atlasʹs Compensation Structure**
- Tim and Adam have been hearing more questions about the tiered salary structure based on position - Amy (from our board) suggested we switch to a tiered system- switch happened in 2005-6 - The lesser of two evils, ensuring that people who do basically the same work get basically the same compensation - What about acquiring new staff at a for-profit rate? - Software developers are paid a certain amount in the field, and we have to meet this rate in order to remain competitive - What about creating new tiers? - If there is a meaningful way to distinguish between the expectations and responsibilities of the two jobs, Adam is open to creating new tiers. However, the idea would be to maintain a relatively flat organizational structure - Do the rates ever get adjusted? - This was done several years ago over the course of three years. Rates were set as targets and 33% was completed each year. - How do you compete with for-profit? Do you adjust salaries based on other non-profits? - The trick is to understand who your competitors are. Kickstarter and NYFA are both our competitors, and it doesn’t really matter whether one is for-profit and one is non-profit.
**B. Ask the ED**
*How was Delaware?* - It was great, and shockingly productive. Having the space away from email was disorienting at first but great. Made Adam think about how to carve out time—because he felt 3x more productive. - Gary: it taught Selena and I to be more self-reliant. - Leila: it was difficult to figure out notarized documents and signatures without consulting with Adam first- can we formalize a system for doing this in the future? - Ian: working on the NEA stuff was both more stressful and more empowering. - Alison: in this stage of a program’s life cycle, where a tiny change can have a huge impact, it’s more important to have Adam’s feedback
MLS: Adam’s position gives him a perspective no one else has, so having his feedback is vitally important
What are your expectations with having everyone here in town? - Mostly want to strengthen rapport, understand each other better, develop shorthand with each other, and get a better perspective on the whole scope of the organization’s activities.
### II. Program Activities
**1. Fiscal Sponsorship (Juliana)** - Innovation incubator project is off the ground - Webinars have started again in the fall, FS chats in December and over the summer - Two new webinars: one on corporate funders, one on gov’t grants

**3. Insurance (Jean Ann)** - Raised binder fees on insurance policies: $100 for base, renewals now $60, $50 on volunteer accident policies

### 2013 October Staff Meeting Minutes

Thursday, October 3rd, 2013 12:00-1:00PM
### October Action Items

### September Action Items
- Find Lisa a Spaces Marketing Fellow- Lisa hasn’t sent the description to the staff yet, but we’ll have the final draft today - Check out the website for Culture Works- it’s gorgeous! - Send travel itineraries to travel@fracturedatlas.org- we’re trying to figure out how to not double-book things, so this is a way for Jason to keep everything organized - Formalize system for notarized documents and signatures (for when Adam is away)- we have not done this yet. Tim sent Alanna the feedback from Adam’s hermitage, and we’re going to consider discussing this.
### Ask the ED
**Fractured U.**
- Adam has three major goals he would like to pursue with Fractured U.: - Keep what’s good about Fractured U. - Do it in a way that doesn’t allow it to deteriorate over time - Keep it at a budget of 10-15K a year - It would be good to get Devon smith on social media, Tom Cott on marketing - Who is managing this? - This is the biggest unanswered question. Two possibilities: 1. Someone on staff steps up and takes this on in addition to their responsibilities or 2. Find an outside consultant to manage the project - In the long term, if it’s a huge hit, Adam could imagine assigning half a PA position to it - Is there a timeline for this all to go into effect? - It would be for this fiscal year - Would it be called the same thing? – Adam thinks so - Why not monetize it? What about dividing it into free sections and other buy-in options? - Having any cost barrier will reduce uptake by 90% or more. Since our audience is much, much smaller than iTunes, for example, this would be impractical. There’s so much awesome free content out there it doesn’t seem that people would pay for it. - Are we prioritizing name recognition over content? - This is not a requirement (name-recognition). Anyone on staff who will put in the work and can do a good job with it would be great. - Could we have content for a curriculum that doesn’t fit the template? - The best way to do that would be for each video to have a “learn more” link that leads to Ted talks, other content, etc. It may make sense to have an “other educational resources” section of the site
### Program Activities
Fractured Atlas Member Video- does this work for the homepage? - The majority said yes, but Adam wants
**Artful.ly Launch Party**
- Nothing is changing with Artful.ly, but we’re taking the beta tag off - If anyone asks if Artful.ly is changing, the answer is no- the party is just an opportunity to celebrate - 15-20 minutes of presentation with Artful.ly video, possibly members of ATC, and then we’ll have cocktails - Target invite list has been funders, potential funders, current artful.ly users, etc. - As we get response to our first invite group, we will open the invitations further - Selena needs hands to help run the event - There will be a live demo showcasing the app, so Selena could use help with that as well - Check out the Artful.ly video at Artful.ly/about - PKPR is doing an awesome job getting us some press- Fast Company online, Wall Street Journal, etc. - Jason: Do we want social media support for this? – Selena is not sure of the timeline for the articles, so we will get more info from PKPR
**Insurance**
- Insurance had been in a bit of a financial slump and we decided to raise our binder fees, which is going very smoothly - Also tried to counteract insistence by insurance companies that people fill out paper applications by having an online signature - Healthcare fees are going away and VISA fees are on the agenda now
**Archipelago**
- Just delivered a milestone to Sustain Arts- probably a big check coming soon - Stamen- has just put out their first release with real data- tons of fun - Ian and Alison traveled to Utica, NY for a presentation of Archie, talked about cultural planning. They’re thinking of creating a cultural district in Utica- hopefully we’ll get to work with them in the future
**Software Consulting**
- Trying to deliver on our work for New World Symphony that’s fully functional, will work for users, and accessible on multiple devices - Software development fellows- 3 months, plan to start at the beginning of the process by learning Ruby, Rails, and then move forward to a collaborative project - We already have two candidates - What are the goals for the fellowship? - set up a pipeline for junior developers. Getting developers in has always been difficult, so it’s a great way to bring people in who are interested in the Fractured Atlas core mission but also interested in software development - Jason: Are there legal stop gaps for blogging about our software development? - We would need to clear it with the customer first, but otherwise it shouldn’t be a problem - Alison: Stamen has a clause in their contract that lets them do just that - Adam: is it desirable to do this? It’s not a mass-market service, so we want to be careful about marketing a service to an audience that’s simply not appropriate for it - Do we have a training program in mind for the fellowship? - Yes, and Shawn can give details for those interested in hearing more
**Fiscal Sponsorship**
- No longer going to have staff assigned to tasks- they’re going to be assigned to projects - Adam is building functionality for auto-assigning tickets - The idea is that staff members would be generalists
**Spaces** - Spacefinder Detriot live- this happened - Want to sync with Archie and Sustain arts so that quality of content is good - Software challenges for international banking for Toronto- launch date is September 2014
**Development**
- Development team has been working with Jason and Ian to get TRG data for donor mailing - Meeting with the Mellon foundation - Meeting with the Ford Foundation coming up next month- one about national strategy for Spaces and the other for Power2Give - Updated OAN membership can be found in the helpdesk now - Dianne: should we be highlighting our members more broadly in advertising? “Artist-Entrepreneurs of the Year” - this could be a press thing- a great way to have cheap publicity - we could combine it with the “Top Ten Artist-Friendly Cities in America” - our own little MacArthur genius grant?
### Operations
**Finance Report**
- Swapped health insurance fees for Visa fees - We’re on the hunt for new employee plans as of January 1st- Emblem health is not complying with the ACA, and is terminating our health insurance - Hopefully by the end of October, we will know what our options are - Audit starts next week - Innovation incubator, Gemini acquisition, and fundraising are all new elements that need to be incorporated into the audit
**Staffing Update** - Ben is switching over to the Development position October 15th - Mauricio left to join a startup in Ann Arbor - Fahad is leaving in November - Two Admin Assistants will be starting October 15th
**"The Advantage"**
- The Fractured Atlas bible for at least the year. - Addresses a lot of things like getting everyone on the same page, breaking down silos, focusing on organizational goals - The Five Dysfunctions of a Team- previous book, available in prose and graphic novel format - Senior staff will be doing quarterly off-sites starting in November

Mac Tips & Tricks

# Mac Tips & Tricks
Feel free to contribute any cool tips and tricks you pick along the way while using a Mac.
## Screenshots
* **Save Screenshot to Desktop:** *Cmd+Shift+4* and then your mouse cursor will turn into crosshairs. Draw a rectangle around the area you want to screenshot and an image will be automatically created and placed on your desktop.
* **Save Screenshot to Clipboard:** *Cmd+Control+Shift+4* and then your mouse cursor will turn into crosshairs. Draw a rectangle around the area you want to screenshot and an image will be stored to your clipboard and ready for pasting.
## Working With Text
These tips are great for manipulating text on a Mac. It works on almost every application, like mail, web, Flowdock, etc.
* **Jump to End of Word:** *Option+Arrow* The arrow can either be left or right arrow depending on the direction you wish to jump.
* **Jump to End of Line:** *Cmd+Arrow* The arrow can either be left or right arrow depending on the direction you wish to jump.
* **Select Word:** *Option+Shift+Arrow* The arrow can either be left or right arrow depending on the direction you wish to select.
* **Select Line:** *Cmd+Shift+Arrow* The arrow can either be left or right arrow depending on the direction you wish to select.
* **Remove Text After Cursor:** *Ctrl+k* will delete all text *after* your cursor. Useful for trimming URLs and such.
* **Emoji:** *Ctrl+Cmd+Space* Opens up the emoji picker on any text field.
* **Define a Word:** *Hover over a word and 3-finger 'touch' the trackpad (don't click)* This will bring up a popup with the definition of the word along with options for loading the Wikipedia entry.
* **Dictate Text** *Double tap FN* This will bring up a microphone icon that will allow you to dictate text and punctuation.
* **Accents and other diacritical marks** hold your finger down on a letter key, and a popup will appear with diacritical marks. Click on the character you want, or use a number key to select it. This works on iPhones, too.
## Multi-tasking
* **Toggle Between Open Apps:** *Cmd+Tab* Quick way to jump between open apps. You can also use *Cmd+Shift+Tab* to move in the other direction.
* **Open Mission Control:** *Ctrl+Up Arrow* This can also be configured as a mouse shortcut in *System Preferences*.
* **Switch Spaces:** *Ctrl+Right or Left Arrow* You can add or remove spaces from the top portion in *Mission Control*. Spaces are like blank desktops you can use to organize your open apps. This can also be customized with mouse shortcuts.
* **Quit App:** *Cmd+q*
* **Close Window:** *Ctrl+w* This will close a single for a given application (like when you have multiple browser windows or email messages open).
## Opening Files and Apps
* **Open a File:** *Cmd+Space* Then type *open* and the filename. *Spotlight* will search your computer for this filename.
* **Open an App:** *Cmd+Space* Then type the name of the app you want to open (doesn't need to be the whole name).
* **Quicklook:** *Select a file and press Space* This will show you a full preview of a file without having to open up the supporting application. Works for almost all file types and works great in *Mail*.
* **Get details about a file** *Cmd+i on a file you've highlighted* this will bring up a pane that gives you detailed information about a file. useful for getting file sizes and other nerdy details.
## Volume and Brightness
There are volume and brightness keys on Mac keyboards, but sometimes each block of brightness or volume is just too loud or too bright. There is a way to move up and down, though, that isn't a full block.
* **Micro Volume Adjustment:** *Option+Shift+Volume Up or Down*
* **Micro Brightness Adjustment:** *Option+Shift+Brightness Up or Down*
## Passwords
Macs come with one built-in password manager that works in Safari and any iOS devices you may have. Additionally, all other system passwords will be stored here along with wifi passwords. So if you ever need to recall a password or give someone the wifi password, open the *Keychain* app.
## Web Browsing
This works in all browsers.
* **Toggle the address bar:** *Cmd+l* This will place your cursor on the address bar and select the existing URL to make it easy for you to type in a new address.
* **Switch Tabs:** *Cmd+Shift+[ or ]* This will navigate to the next tab to the left or right of your current tab, respectively. This actually works for all tabbed applications as well.
* **Open New Tav:** *Cmd+t*
* **Refresh Page:** *Cmd+r*
Membership Kit Activation (Save For Out of Beta)

## To Activate the Membership Kit
1. Navigate to your **Account Administration** Page. You can find Account Administration in the grey box when you log into your account, or by clicking on your email address in the upper right corner of the menu bar.
![Account Information](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=153 "Account Information")
2. Find the **Memberships Kit** and click the activate button.
![Kit Button](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=152 "Kit Button")
3. This will send a request to Artful.ly HQ where a staff member will reach out to you about activating the kit.
![Activate Membership Kit](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=151 "Activate Membership Kit")

### Ask the ED
Adam wants to answer questions about the memo he sent last week:
- 2 major mission categories for mission impact: language of mission statement lends itself to thinking about outcomes of impacts. Thinking about why we want to remove barriers to artistic expression and what that would look like – leveling the playing field and providing an opportunity for more voices to get out there. Are we in fact eliminating barriers? The greatest indicator of that would be a proliferation of voices. diversity with a lowercase ‘d’ – not strictly talking about racial, ethnic diversity – talking about it in a broader sense. Haven’t gotten to a point where we know what the specific metrics will be. For FA’s mission as a whole, what should we be measuring that success of that mission by? - Premium level of service: we don’t know yet what the premium level will bring forth. Do premium members get premium customer service? It’s possible that ultra-premium members will have a dedicated staff member but we only have half-baked ideas for the time being. - My Stuff drop down menu – possible to change it to be on the front page so that members don’t have to go looking for important links? We will develop a centralized member dashboard that will take care of this problem. Not within the next couple months but not too far in the future either. - The timeline for this thematic goal is the end of May. But we don’t expect to accomplish everything outlined in the memo by then. - Single login is finally happening! It’s all set to be clearly branded under Fractured Atlas now.

Looking to partner with Con Edison. - Meeting with Ford this month. - Very interested in what happens with the membership party – we want to be able to bring donors to that to sponsor Spaces (e.g., SpaceFinder NYC brought to you by Con Edison).

Creating PDFs and combining PDFs in Preview

### Creating PDFs in Preview
Let's say that you want to turn all 4 of these puppy jpegs into pdfs:
![Picture of puppies](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=625 "puppies demo")
1. Select the files 1. Two-finger click and open in Preview (note: this is not necessary if Preview is your default program. Simply double click the images to open in Preview) 1. Highlight the files you want and two finger click. 1. Choose Export As... -> PDF
![Picture of puppies](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=626 "more puppies")
(Note: If you are only converting one file to pdf, you can get there more quickly by going to File -> Export to PDF)
### Combining PDFs in Preview
Now, lets say you want all of these puppies to be a multi page pdf.
1. Open one of your Puppy pdfs. 2. Click on the little icon that looks like two columns and a down arrow and click thumbnails. 3. Now drag your second file into the empty space near the thumbnail like so:
![Picture of puppies](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=627 "even more puppies")
4. There you have a multi page PDF! Just click save as to save it in your desired location.
You can also page mark up in a variety of ways:
![Puppies](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=628 "Wow, that's seriously a lot of puppies")
More Preview info:
[How to Highlight](http://www.simpopdf.com/resource/highlight-text-in-pdf-on-mac-with-preview.html)
[All sorts of handy Preview info, including how to annotate](http://www.macworld.com/article/2045686/editing-and-annotating-pdf-files-with-preview.html)
Marketing Your Venue's Accessibility Features with Virtual Tours

### Examples of virtual tours: - Casa Frela in Harlem, NYC - IATI Theatre's Rehearsal Space, NYC - The Lucid Body House, NYC - The Abbey Pub, Chicago Virtual tours give potential visitors a comprehensive view of your space - from the entrance to the workspaces to the dressing and restrooms. They're a great way to highlight your venue's unique features and a valuable resource for visitors -- whether they’re interested in rehearsing in your studios or attending a performance. For disabled artists and audiences, a virtual tour helps assess whether or not your space will meet their needs. **An in-depth look at the interior of your space enables patrons to view:** - The layout of your space, for audiences and artists - Unique features and details not mentioned on your website or on your listing ... and more! **And helps disabled patrons answer questions such as:** - Is the entrance to the venue wheelchair accessible? - Will I be able to access this space and work in it comfortably? - Are hallways and doorways wide enough for wheelchair users to navigate easily? - Is there adequate and clear signage throughout the venue? - Are accessible restrooms located on the same floor as your facilities? ... and more! A virtual tour can either be a video of a space taken by you or a media artist, or a 360 degree view using Google Places. Then, you can link to the tour on your SpaceFinder listing by pasting the URL in the **Virtual Tour** field of the **Accessibility** section. ### Google Places 360 Degree Tour This kind of virtual tour can be photographed by a Google certified photographer. To find a list of recommended photographers, check out [Google's list.](https://www.google.com/maps/streetview/trusted/) **If you're located in the New York region, we recommend: [PlacesMobile, Inc.](http://www.placesmobile.com/)** While using a virtual tour to document your space can be slightly more costly than a self-produced video, it provides the most thorough coverage of all it’s nooks and crannies--with minimal work on your behalf! After you've chosen a photographer, they'll spend less than an hour taking impressions of the interior of your space. Then, they'll take the impressions and put them together to create the 360-degree view and post it on Google Streetview. From there, you can grab the embed link from Google and include in your listing or link to it from your website! ### Virtual Tour Example Check out the work done by PlacesMobile, Inc. on a couple NYC venues [here.](http://art-ny.tourmytown.us/)

Adding People to MailChimp Lists or Groups

Through Artful.ly's integration with MailChimp, you can add fans to your people database either through Artful.ly or through MailChimp.
##Adding People To Your Mailing List via MailChimp
- When a fan signs up via your [MailChimp sign up form,](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/signup-forms/create-signup-forms-and-response-emails) she is added to your mailing list. Then, MailChimp sends the person's contact information to Artful.ly, where we create a new record for them. - When a fan signs up via a [MailChimp widget or link that you installed on your website,](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/signup-forms/host-your-own-signup-forms) she's added to your mailing list. Then, MailChimp sends the contact information to Artful.ly, and a new people record is created. - You can also [import a list of people directly to a MailChimp list.](http://kb.mailchimp.com/lists/growth/import-subscribers-to-a-list)
##Adding People To Your Mailing List via Artful.ly
There are a few different ways that you can add a people from your Artful.ly account to your MailChimp lists or groups, either individually or in batches.
This is good for: - Keeping members subscribed to a members-only group on MailChimp - Subscribing folks to interest-specific groups. - Sending follow-up messages to groups of people who have attended specific events or series of events.
##Add Individuals When They Opt-in to Your List With an Order
This happens when a fan purchases something or make a donation through your Artful.ly storefront and signs up during checkout. If she does not already have an Artful.ly record, one is created for her. Then, Artful.ly tells MailChimp to add her to your mailing list.
##Manually Add Individuals to Your Mailing List
To add an individual to one of your mailing lists or groups, go to their people record.
1. If they wish to be removed from a mailing list or group, uncheck the box next to the appropriate list. Then click **Save.** 2. To add them, check the box next to the appropriate mailing list or group. Then click **Save.**
![Add individual to specific mailing list](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=636 "Add individual to specific mailing list")
3. Select the appropriate scenario to confirm. If the individual has given you permission to add them to the list, then you do not need to send him or her an invitation to join. If he or she has not yet given permission, select the option to have Artful.ly send an invitation to join the list. Then click **Save**.
[(More about permissions and compliance with anti-spam laws.)](http://kb.mailchimp.com/accounts/compliance-tips/guidelines-for-list-compliance?&_ga=1.215225951.913571212.1401485725)
![Confirm adding an individual to a mailing list or group](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=637 "Confirm adding an individual to a mailing list or group")
##Send Invitation from Order via Box Office or Sales Console
It's also possible to send an invitation to join your mailing list when you're processing an order on behalf of a fan through either the Box Office or through the Sales Console. When you're entering the person's contact and payment information, you'll see this as the last step before checking out.
![Send invite to mailing list at checkout](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=643 "Send invite to mailing list at checkout")
##Add a Batch of People
**From Advanced Search**
1. From the top navigation bar, go to **People** then **Advanced Search**. 2. Use search conditions to identify a batch of people. 3. Click on the **Work With...** button. 4. Select **Subscribe to MailChimp list** or **Subscribe to MailChimp list group** and then select the appropriate list or group.
![Advanced Search Dropdwon Menu](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=780 "Advanced Search Dropdwon Menu")
**From a List Segment**
1. From the top navigation bar, go to **People** then **List Segments**. 2. Select a list segment. 3. Click on the **Work With...** button. 4. Select **Subscribe to MailChimp list** or **Subscribe to MailChimp list group** and then select the appropriate list or group.
![Add people from a list segment](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=847 "Add people from a list segment")
* If you are adding people to a list, this will subscribe users that are not already subscribed to the list. They will receive a confirmation email and will only be successfully subscribed once they've accepted the invitation. * If you are adding people to a group, this will only add users to a group if they are subscribed to the list already.
Note: This is a one-time push to add people to your MailChimp account, it will not happen automatically for new additions to your database. After this, when you add new people to an Artful.ly segment, you'll need to go through these steps again to add them to the MailChimp list or group.
##Related Articles - [Connecting Your Artful.ly and MailChimp Accounts](/site/knowledgebase/connecting-your-artful-ly-mailchimp-accounts) - [What is MailChimp and why should I use it?](/site/knowledgebase/what-is-mailchimp-and-why-should-i-use-it)
How do I update my MailChimp lists and groups in Artful.ly?

On September 22, 2015, we released version 2.0 of our Mailchimp integration. In order to take advantage of the updated integration features and see these changes on your account, you may need to re-sync the Artful.ly connection with MailChimp.
This also applies to you if you ever add, delete, rename, or reorganize the lists and groups in your MailChimp account. To see these changes reflected in Artful.ly, you'll most likely need to resync the connection between the two apps. (But you should NOT have to change or update your API key.)
When you are logged in as an Organization administrator, here's how to re-sync:
1. Go to your **Account Administration** page, then view the **Kits** section. 2. Under MailChimp, click **Configure**. 3. Select **Manage my connected lists**.
![Manage connected lists button](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=638 "Manage connected lists button")
4. Do not change any of the settings on this page, just click on the **Save** button at the bottom. This will kick off the sync.
![Save button to resync connection](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=639 "Save button to resync connection")
**Note:** It may take some time for the sync to complete, especially if you've got a lot of subscribers. If you don't see changes right away, check back after an hour.
### Related Articles - [Connecting Your Artful.ly and MailChimp Accounts](/site/knowledgebase/connecting-your-artful-ly-mailchimp-accounts) - [Adding People to MailChimp Lists or Groups](/site/knowledgebase/adding-people-to-mailchimp-lists-or-groups) - [What is MailChimp and why should I use it?](/site/knowledgebase/what-is-mailchimp-and-why-should-i-use-it)
How do I make a custom Artful.ly URL?

Artful.ly automatically creates a unique URL for your Central Storefront, where you can send your fans to purchase tickets, passes, and memberships. Since you'll likely be sharing this link a lot (we hope!), it's totally possible to customize it.
To update it:
1. Go to your **Account Administration** page and view the **Basics** section. 2. Click on **Edit**.
![Edit account information](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=640 "Edit account information")
3. In the **Storefront URL** text field, enter the text you'd like to include in your Storefront link.
![Edit storefront URL text in this box](/site/Knowledgebase/view_image?id=641 "Edit storefront URL text in this box")
### Related Articles - [Sell Tickets via Central Storefront & Event Storefront](/site/knowledgebase/sell-tickets-via-central-storefront-event-storefront)
Request Per Diem for Travel

### Travel Expenses
When staff members are out of the office due to necessary business travel, Fractured Atlas will pay for the following:
- all core travel expenses including hotel, airfare, train, bus - a rental car with gas and tolls if deemed necessary with prior approval by a supervisor - roundtrip transportation between the airport and hotel in the destination city is covered for up to $80 total or $40 each way.
If you choose to travel between the airport and hotel via methods that exceed the allowance in the destination city, you will have to pay for the difference out of pocket and you will not be reimbursed. Employees traveling together may choose to combine this allowance if they so wish.
### Per Diem
Fractured Atlas will provide a daily Per Diem rate as dictated by the Federal General Services Administration which sets specific rates pegged to each region of the country annually. The Per Diem is intended to cover: - Meals - Incidental expenses (IE are defined as tips given to porters, baggage carriers, bellhops, hotel maids and transportation between places of lodging/business and places where meals are taken, it suitable meals cannot be obtained on site). - Travel to and from your home and your local airport should come out of your per diem.
The M&IE allowance will be disbursed prior to the trip and may be used at the staff member's discretion; however, receipts and documentation are requested whenever possible and are required if an expense exceeds $75. If no M&I documentation can be provided within 30 days following the travel dates, the unused portion of the disbursement must be returned to the Managing Director in order to comply with the law.
The current M&I rates for every region of the country can be found here: http://www.gsa.gov/portal/content/104877 **First and last days of travel are calculated at 75% of the posted M&IE rate. **
NOTE: Any meals/events where a staff member picks up the tab for a large group of professional associates may be charged to the company credit card and a receipt will be required. It the staff member received per diem then a % of the cost will be deducted from their next per diem disbursement. Refer to the handbook for further details.

### Ask the ED: Adam Huttler (15 minutes)
**Q- How was your Hermitage? **
**A: **Great! It was good, tried best to be as productive as possible. I wanted to not make problems, but I have no idea if was successful in that. Hopefully it is helpful. I got everything done that could be done. There are some areas of functionality that I wanted to steer clear of. Will do post mortem to check in on how things went.
**Q (Jason)- Will there be another stake of org memo? **
**A: **There probably should be, but unsure what the right occasion would be.
**Q (Nathan)- Have you thought about re-estimating our reach? Now the membership has jumped. before it was neat to say that membership is 10% of reach, that we're reaching more people.**
**A- **Interesting to think about membership and reach in that way. I will take a look at this.
**Q (Caitlin)- Will there be a new Thematic Goal?**
**A-** Not now, there are still things that fall into general heading of SSO, but it has yet to be put under the heading of SSO. Will probably happen after director of programs is hired.
**Q (Jillian)- Can you talk a little bit about the restructuring with the Director of Programs?**
**A- **The basic concept is that the Director of Programs is being hired, they will report to me and the program directors will go to them. There will be two teams (programs team and institutions team) One of the mandates will to ensure that programs are stronger as whole than separately.
**Q (Malcolm): I know that you have had thoughts about Taylor Swift as leader in terms of copyright law, but how do those thoughts play into her being a figurehead of white feminism. **
**A-**I plead the 5th. I have to say that I don't really have enough information to answer this, but I would be open to discussing.
**Q (Tim): Can you talk a little bit about Singularity University? **
**A- **It will be at the end of Sept (26th-Oct 1) so will miss staff meeting. The singularity is increasingly popular idea having to do with the theory that information technology follows an exponential growth curve. Moores law (number of circuits doubles every few years). What's interesting with exponential growth curves is that they approach infinity. What happens when these things go vertical? Ex. what happens when a robot can make a robot twice as smart as itself in one day. Basic premise is compelling. Could be dramatic for humanity when it happens--in our lifetimes. Started by Google and other entrepreneurs, made to gather people to talk about it. This is the first time doing something with Professional Development funds. It was interesting to explain to board. We need to think about these kinds of majorly disruptive technological updates. Hopefully we will learn cool things. There is a group of about 80 people.
**Q (Jason): As person who manages blog, I have noticed it needs some love. **
**A: **Yeah the blog sucks. I would love to move it to medium, but I would like someone to transfer this to someone else to take charge on this. I would welcome this.
**Jason-** Task force? **A-**maybe.
